0.title: Strange 'heartbeat' signal from distant galaxy detected by scientists
0.article_body: Scientists have detected a strange and persistent radio signal from a far-off galaxy that appears to be flashing with regularity. The signal could emanate from either a radio pulsar or a magnetar, both of which are types of neutron stars. "There were periodic peaks that were remarkably precise, emitting every fraction of a second...like a heartbeat," said MIT's Daniele Michilli.

1.title: There's misgovernance, corruption in Mumbai civic body: Deora
1.article_body: Congress leader Milind Deora said there is "misgovernance and corruption" in Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation and that the municipality's recent delimitation was done to benefit the Shiv Sena. The BMC elections are scheduled for later this year and Deora said the Congress should be ready to take on Shiv Sena. Last year, the number of BMC seats increased to 236.

2.title: 5 dead, 9 hurt as godown wall collapses in Delhi; PM says, 'anguished'
2.article_body: Five people died and nine others sustained injuries after a wall collapsed at an under-construction godown in Delhi's Alipur on Friday, police said. The injured persons are undergoing treatment at a hospital and two of them are said to be in critical condition. "Anguished by the mishap...My thoughts are with those who've lost their loved ones," PM Narendra Modi said.

3.title: Mumbai Metro-3 car depot site home to 5 leopards: Study
3.article_body: A camera trapping study at the Mumbai Metro Line-3 car depot site in Aarey Milk Colony has found the presence of five leopards in it. Jungle cats, mongooses and monitor lizards were also found. The depot project was stalled after the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi state government declared the area as forest land and moved the project out of there.

4.title: He needs bit more willpower to emerge from this phase: Saba on Kohli's form
4.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's dismissal in second ODI against England, Saba Karim said the India batter needs a little more concentration and stronger willpower to emerge from the ongoing phase of low scores. Kohli scored 16 runs off 25 deliveries at Lord's on Thursday. The ex-India captain scored his last international century in November 2019.

5.title: 65-year-old man shot dead inside mosque in UP
5.article_body: A 65-year-old man was shot dead inside a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Khurja Nagar on Friday, police said. Idris, a resident of Sheikhpen locality, was attacked while he and his sons were walking on a road. Thereafter, Idris reportedly rushed inside the mosque. His family said the crime has been committed by their acquaintances who belong to the same community.

6.title: 1 soldier killed, 3 injured in alleged fratricide incident in J&K
6.article_body: A soldier was killed and three others were injured in an alleged fratricide incident inside an Army camp in the Surankote area of Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Friday, officials have confirmed. The injured persons were airlifted to an Army hospital in Udhampur and one of them is said to be in a critical condition, as per reports.

7.title: Kyrgios is still disappointed to come so close but not win Wimbledon: Hewitt
7.article_body: Talking about Nick Kyrgios, who reached his maiden Grand slam final at Wimbledon last week, ex-world number one Lleyton Hewitt said deep down the fellow Australian is still disappointed to come so close but not win Wimbledon title. He added that Kyrgios should be proud of his whole grass-court season. Novak Djokovic beat Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in final.

8.title: Men offer Namaz in Lulu's biggest Indian mall in UP, FIR filed as video goes viral
8.article_body: An FIR was filed against unidentified men who were seen, in a viral video, offering Namaz at Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall in UP's Lucknow. The FIR was filed on a complaint registered by the mall authorities. "Lulu Mall respects all religions," said the mall's General Manager Sameer Verma, adding, "Any kind of religious work or prayer isn't permitted here."

9.title: You work hard to get popular, when you get popular you hide: Ranbir
9.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that any actor who says they don't enjoy the attention they get will be lying. "You work so hard to get popular, then when you get popular you go and hide. It's ironic," he added. Ranbir further said he wishes he could hold on to some personal life and keep it private but it's okay.

10.title: Gurugram Police grants interfaith couple protection over threat to life
10.article_body: An interfaith couple was granted protection by Gurugram Police after the woman's family allegedly threatened to kill them, the police said on Thursday. The Muslim woman had left her home on July 8 to live with her Hindu partner, the police added. The couple was granted police protection after the woman's family assaulted them.

11.title: Rare whirlwind destroys farmland in Madhya Pradesh, video surfaces
11.article_body: A video of a rare whirlwind destroying a farmland in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain has surfaced online. In the video, locals can be seen witnessing the whirlwind, with some taking pictures and videos. "Nature can ruin everything in a second," a social media user commented on the video. "It looks scary," wrote another.

12.title: Development not possible without establishing peace: J&K LG
12.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha on Friday said development was not possible without establishing peace, adding that some people were trying to provoke security forces and the administration to fuel unrest. The security forces are working hard round-the-clock for the safety and security of the common people, Sinha said. There's need to create awareness in the society, Sinha added.

13.title: India-made ring with 24,679 diamonds sets Guinness World Record, pics surface
13.article_body: A mushroom-shaped diamond ring made by Kerala's SWA Diamonds set a new Guinness World Record in May 2022 for the 'most diamonds set in one ring'. The ring named 'The Touch of Ami' has a total of 24,679 diamonds and was manufactured in Malappuram. It has been designed by Rijisha TV, who's a post-graduate from the National Institute of Design.

14.title: PM Narendra Modi calls TN CM Stalin to enquire about his health
14.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday called Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin to enquire about his health after the latter tested positive for COVID-19 and was admitted to Kauvery Hospital in Chennai. During the call, MK Stalin thanked PM Modi and invited him to the inauguration of the 44th International Chess Olympiad which will commence on July 28 in Mamallapuram.

15.title: China sees most COVID-19 cases since May
15.article_body: China on Thursday reported 432 COVID-19 cases, up from 292 on Wednesday and the most since May 25. Over a third or 165 cases were found in Guangxi province. As of Monday, some three crore people across China were under some form of movement restrictions to quell COVID-19 transmission. China has reported more than 51 lakh virus cases so far.

16.title: Can jobless youth use unparliamentary words like 'misled, cheated'?: Rahul
16.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday criticised PM Narendra Modi over the issue of joblessness. While sharing a graph showing percentage of unemployment in the last five years, Rahul asked, "Where are the two crore jobs/year, Prime Minister?" "Misled. Betrayed. Cheated. Prime Minister, can India's unemployed youth use these 'unparliamentary' words for your lies?" he further stated.

17.title: Road made with 3,000 kgs plastic waste to ease traffic in B'luru
17.article_body: A newly-constructed road, entirely made with 3,000 kilograms of plastic waste, has been opened to public in Bengaluru. The road will connect Outer Ring Road and RMZ Ecoworld in Bellandur. The new stretch, first of its kind in the city, is expected to decongest heavy traffic during peak hours and reduce the commute time by 30 minutes.

18.title: I want to play negative characters like Thanos or Joker: Sanjay Dutt
18.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt stated that he wants to play negative characters like Thanos from the 'Avengers' films or Joker from 'The Dark Knight'. "I don't like to play all-negative characters. There has to be something about that character so you say yes," he added. The actor said his character Kancha from 2012 film 'Agneepath' was menacing but read Bhagavad Gita.

19.title: Pacer Navdeep Saini joins Kent to play in English domestic cricket
19.article_body: Indian pacer Navdeep Saini has joined the Kent County Cricket Club to play in the ongoing English domestic cricket season. The 29-year-old bowler has signed a contract to play a total of eight games, subject to his visa clearance. "In a year when it's been difficult to take wickets, we're excited to...add [Saini]," said Paul Downton, the Director of Kent.

20.title: MHA website ranks 1st among central ministry services portals: Govt
20.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has ranked first and its Digital Police portal second in a service delivery assessment of websites of central government ministries. The National e-Governance Service Delivery Assessment is a periodic assessment intended to improve the effectiveness of the states and Union Territories and the central government in the delivery of their online services to the public.

21.title: He'd keep telling Alia and me 'Go and get married': Ranbir on father Rishi
21.article_body: Discussing his late father and actor Rishi Kapoor, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "We spent a lot of time with him in New York in the hospital, Alia Bhatt and [me], and he kept telling us, 'Why're you...wasting...time?'" "Go and get married...Why're you sitting in the hospital," added Ranbir, sharing his father's words. "He always used to joke around," stated Ranbir.

22.title: Became poster boy of a cheater, people haven't heard my perspective: Ranbir
22.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said in an interview that he was made the "poster boy of a casanova, of a cheater". "People have heard somebody's perspective, somebody's point of view and they haven't heard mine," he said. Ranbir, however, added that it doesn't bother him if "somebody bi**es" about him or if anyone says anything bad about him.

23.title: Tara to make singing debut in 'Ek Villain...', song to release on July 16
23.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria is all set to make her singing debut with a song titled 'Shaamat' for her upcoming film 'Ek Villain Returns'. She took to Instagram on Friday to share the news with her fans and followers and added that the song will be released on July 16. The lyrics for the song have been written by Prince Dubey.

24.title: ODI format suits Dhawan the best; glad selectors showed faith: Manjrekar
24.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said that the one-day cricket format suits a lot to India's opening batter Shikhar Dhawan. "This is a format [ODI] that suits him best...where he's been excellent. And I'm so glad that selectors have shown faith in him," Manjrekar said. "If you look at his [ODI] performances, it's always been the best," he added.

25.title: Patna SSP likens Islamic extremist outfit PFI to RSS, sparks row
25.article_body: Patna's SSP Manavjit Singh Dhillon compared the training of Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) with the training at Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) shakhas on Thursday. "[PFI's] modus operandi was to act like an RSS shakha…They'd call [youths] for physical training but also…radicalise them," he said. Bihar BJP spokesperson condemned his remarks and called for his resignation.

26.title: KK's family calls his death 'worst pain', says 'He was a different species'
26.article_body: Late singer KK's family has shared a note on his official Instagram handle, saying that his death is the worst pain they have experienced. "He was a different species of human, not only...as a performer but...as a father/husband," the note read. It added that KK "got the chance to be doing what he loved almost until his last moments".

27.title: Will target Russian gold in next sanctions package: EU
27.article_body: The European Union will target Russian gold exports in its next sanctions package and seek to "close exit routes" for those bypassing its earlier packages, Maros Sefcovic, deputy head of European Commission, said. So far, EU has approved six sanction packages against Russia over Ukraine war. The last package, passed in June, implemented a ban on most Russian oil imports.

28.title: Delhi traffic signals to get signages indicating speed limits, timer displays
28.article_body: Traffic signals in Delhi will soon get electronic signages indicating speed limits, reports said. Timer displays will also be added to signals. Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena has directed officials to install these devices at all traffic intersections across city. Delhi Police have also been asked to ensure least manual interventions for enforcement and challans in the national capital.

29.title: Under-construction godown wall collapses in Delhi; 5 dead & 2 critical
29.article_body: Five people have died and nine have been injured after a wall of an under-construction godown collapsed in Delhi's Alipur on Friday. The injured people, two of whom are in critical condition, have been hospitalised. Delhi Police fear that some people may still be trapped under the debris. The incident reportedly took place at Bakoli village near Chauhan Dharam Kanta.

30.title: Mumbai reports 3 swine flu cases in 10 days; toll reaches 7
30.article_body: In the first 10 days of July, three swine flu (H1N1) cases were recorded in Mumbai. The total number of H1N1 cases reported in the city so far has reached seven. "In the last two months, we have seen a 6-10% rise in Influenza A infections as compared to the previous year," a doctor at the SRV Mamata Hospital said.

31.title: Chhattisgarh govt to buy cattle urine from farmers at ₹4 per litre
31.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government is planning to procure cattle urine from farmers and cattle owners at ₹4 per litre. A pilot project of the scheme will be launched in the upcoming weeks, officials informed on Friday. According to Pradeep Sharma, adviser to CM Bhupesh Baghel, the urine will be procured through Gram Gauthan Samiti and payments will be made fortnightly.

32.title: Hundreds more evacuated as wildfires spread in France
32.article_body: Hundreds more people were evacuated from their homes as wildfires continued to spread in southwestern France, authorities said on Friday. Since Tuesday, more than 1,000 firefighters supported by nine water-bomber planes have been battling to contain two wildfires fanned by scorching heat, tinder-box conditions and strong winds. The wildfires have burnt around 7,300 hectares of land so far.

33.title: Which are the top 10 dental colleges in India as per govt's rankings released today?
33.article_body: As per the latest rankings released by the government today, Saveetha Institute of Medical and Technical Sciences in Chennai has been ranked the best dental college. It is followed by Manipal's Manipal College of Dental Sciences and Pune's Dr DY Patil Vidyapeeth. Maulana Azad Institute of Dental Sciences in Delhi has been ranked fourth.

34.title: Sushmita shares 1st post after Lalit Modi says they are dating, says 'clarified enough'
34.article_body: Sushmita Sen has shared her first post after Lalit Modi revealed that they are dating. Sharing a picture with her daughters, Sushmita wrote, I am in a happy place. Not married...no rings...Enough clarification given...now back to life & work," she wrote. "Thank you for sharing in my happiness always, and for those who don't...it's #NOYB anyway," she added.

35.title: MP man threatened for supporting Nupur Sharma; 5 arrested
35.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Sehore was allegedly threatened for supporting former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma who was suspended after her remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The police booked and arrested five people after receiving a complaint in the matter. "Nobody will be allowed to disrupt peace in the state," said MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra.

36.title: Most of the current actors have forgotten what heroism is: Sanjay Dutt
36.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said most of the current actors have forgotten what heroism is and what commercial cinema is all about. "There's nothing to [be] scared of in working opposite each other...Don't get insecure," added Sanjay. Discussing the characters he would like to play, Sanjay stated 'Thanos' from 'Avengers: Infinity War' and 'Joker' from the 'Batman' franchise would be fun.

37.title: Godavari water rises to 19 lakh cusecs in Andhra, crosses 3rd danger level
37.article_body: Hundreds of villages are facing a flood situation as the flood water in the Godavari river has risen to over 19 lakh cusecs in Andhra Pradesh, reports said. Reports added the flood water has crossed third danger signal at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage at Dowaleswaram near Rajamahendravaram. An official said water could touch 22-23 lakh cusecs in few hours.

38.title: 3 GHMC employees held for creating fake fingerprints in Hyderabad
38.article_body: The Central Zone Task Force on Thursday arrested three Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) employees for their alleged involvement in creating fake fingerprints. The accused allegedly created fake fingerprints to mark the attendance of sanitation workers through the biometric machine. Police also seized 43 fake fingerprints and thumb impressions along with three biometric machines.

39.title: Hotels told to remove word 'beef' from signs in Arunachal's Naharlagun
39.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh's Naharlagun sub-division administration has issued an order directing hotels and restaurants in the area to remove the word 'beef' from their signboards by July 18 to maintain the "spirit of secularism". As per the order, a ₹2,000 fine will be imposed and a process to cancel trade license will be started if an establishment fails to do so.

40.title: Thane man rapes, strangles 10-year-old daughter; arrested
40.article_body: Police on Friday said that a 10-year-old girl was allegedly raped and strangled to death by her father in Thane's Bhiwandi. The 34-year-old accused was arrested for the crime that took place on Thursday, police said, adding the accused strangled the girl to death with a piece of cloth. A case has been registered under relevant sections of POCSO Act.

41.title: Goa man killed for objecting to people trying to gatecrash his b'day
41.article_body: A man was allegedly beaten to death on his 22nd birthday by some people after he objected to their attempt to gatecrash his party in a slum area near Margao in Goa, police said. Five people have been arrested over the incident. The accused assaulted the deceased with a log of wood and a ring-like object, SP Abhishek Dhania said.

42.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.5 lakh by fraudster posing as her boss
42.article_body: A 53-year-old woman working as secretary in a Mumbai hotel was cheated of ₹2.5 lakh by a person impersonating the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of the hotel. The accused asked the woman to purchase 25 e-gift cards of ₹10,000 each from an e-commerce company, police said. The next afternoon, when she met the COO, she learnt she had been cheated.

43.title: Photo of couple kissing amid anti-government protests in Sri Lanka goes viral
43.article_body: A photo of a couple kissing amid anti-government protests in Sri Lanka, with scores of protestors standing in the backdrop, has gone viral. The man and the woman are seen kissing during the protest at the Prime Minister's office in Colombo. Many Twitter users reacted to the photo, with one comment reading, "Love in the middle of a firefight."

44.title: Musk accused lawyers of causing trouble by seeking deal's financing info: Twitter
44.article_body: In its lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has shared a purported image of a text message that Musk sent to CEO Parag Agrawal before terminating the deal. Musk's message read, "Your lawyers are using these conversations to cause trouble….That needs to stop." Musk's message was in response to the company seeking information regarding the deal's financing.

45.title: Playing quintessential B'wood hero is hardest, easy to do good film: Ranbir
45.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said playing a quintessential Bollywood hero is the hardest, adding that acting in a good film is "easy". "There's a lot that goes [into it]...It takes the right amount of conviction...[and also]...heaps of luck," stated Ranbir. Discussing his film 'Shamshera', Ranbir said he may not have had the confidence to do such a film 10 years ago.

46.title: Saudi Arabia will open its airspace to Israeli airlines: Israel's PM
46.article_body: Amid US President Joe Biden's visit to Middle East, Israel's PM Yair Lapid announced that Saudi Arabia will open airspace to Israeli airlines. The development comes "after a long road of intense and covert diplomacy with Saudi Arabia and the US", Lapid said. Biden, who welcomed the decision, said that it was an important step towards stability in the region.

47.title: Almost all states prepared draft rules on labour codes: Bhupender Yadav
47.article_body: Union Minister Bhupender Yadav has said that almost all Indian states have prepared draft rules on the four labour codes. "Almost all states have finalised draft rules...We will implement the codes [in one go] at an appropriate time," Yadav said. He added that there are a few Northeastern states, including Meghalaya, which have not completed the process yet.

48.title: Netflix ties up with Microsoft for cheaper ad-supported subscription
48.article_body: Netflix has announced a partnership with Microsoft for its ad-supported subscription plan. The technology giant will serve as a "global advertising technology and sales partner" for the streaming service. Netflix had announced in April that it was looking to offer a cheaper ad-supported option to its customers after nearly 200,000 subscribers left the platform in this year's first quarter.

49.title: B'luru parks to stay open for 2.5 hrs more, maintenance breaks shortened
49.article_body: Bengaluru parks will now stay open for 2.5 hours more, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has said. The maintenance breaks have been shortened to be held between 10:00 am to 1:30 pm from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm. Chief Commissioner of BBMP took to Twitter to share the circular by the civic body.

50.title: Don't stop vehicles unless visible traffic violation: Goa IGP to officials
50.article_body: Goa Inspector General of Police (IGP) Omvir Singh on Friday ordered officials to not stop vehicles unless there is a visible traffic violation. "It has been reported that traffic police are stopping the vehicles needlessly...for the want of checking of requisite documents of the vehicles," he said. "Public is alleging undue harassment and has alleged inconvenience," Singh further said.

51.title: 'Chup' is a commercial thriller, will release in theatres: Director
51.article_body: Director R Balki has said his upcoming film 'Chup', starring Sunny Deol and Dulquer Salmaan, is a "commercial thriller", which will be released in theatres in the next two months. "[It's] in a world never done before. The thought is very relevant today," Balki added. Pooja Bhatt and Shreya Dhanwanthary are also part of the film.

52.title: John, 'Special OPS' director Shivam team up for a geopolitical thriller
52.article_body: Shivam Nair, who helmed 'Special OPS' and 'Naam Shabana', has said he is working on a geopolitical thriller which will feature John Abraham in the lead role. "I have been working on this...A lot of hard work and research has gone into the creation of the story structure and this script," he said. John is currently working on action-thriller 'Tehran'.

53.title: World no. 24 Saina loses to world no. 30 Ohori in Singapore Open quarters
53.article_body: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal lost to world number 30 Aya Ohori of Japan 13-21, 21-15, 20-22 in women's singles quarter-final at Singapore Open 2022 on Friday. The world number 24 lost the match in one hour three minutes. In men's singles quarter-final, India's HS Prannoy was beaten by world number 43 Kodai Naraoka. The Japanese defeated Prannoy 12-21, 21-14, 21-18.

54.title: 2 journalists shot at in UP's Sonbhadra, FIR filed
54.article_body: Two journalists working with Hindi newspapers were shot at by bike-borne suspects in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra district on Thursday, said police. They were rushed to the BHU Medical College and were said to be out of danger. The incident occurred when the journalists were having tea at a restaurant in Kaliyari market, said police. An FIR has been registered.

55.title: Attach bank accounts of person in Shree Ramkrishna Electro case: SEBI
55.article_body: SEBI has ordered the attachment of bank accounts along with share and mutual fund holdings of an individual to recover about ₹18 crore in the Shree Ramkrishna Electro Controls case. The recovery proceedings have been ordered against Chandrakant Bhargav Gole to recover ₹5.74 crore collected by the company along with ₹12.53 crore at 15% interest per annum.

56.title: Kerala issues alert as monkeypox patient had co-passengers from 5 districts
56.article_body: Kerala on Friday issued an alert to all 14 districts, a day after India confirmed its first monkeypox case in the state. "People from Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha and Kottayam, travelled along with the infected person from the UAE," state Health Minister Veena George said. Eleven of the patient's contacts have been put under the high-risk category, she added.

57.title: I lived in a small room, there were 7-8 of us: Actor Anil Kapoor
57.article_body: Recalling the time when his family was struggling financially, Anil Kapoor said, "[We lived] in a small room where there were...seven-eight of us." "My mother and father [earlier lived in]...an outhouse," added Anil. Anil stated his life's turning point was when he was informed that his father had heart issues, adding he started working as a spot boy at 17.

58.title: Pune civic body to provide free COVID-19 booster doses at 68 centres
58.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to provide free COVID-19 booster doses at 68 vaccination centres run by the health department. These centres will have both Covaxin and Covishield doses for beneficiaries, officials said. "In PMC limits, there are over three million beneficiaries from 18 and above age group who are yet to receive the booster dose," the immunisation officer said.

59.title: Fadnavis meets Raj, wishes him a speedy recovery; pics surface
59.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis met MNS chief Raj Thackeray at his residence in Mumbai today. He also shared pictures and a video of the meeting on Twitter. Fadnavis said that he inquired about Raj's health and wished him a speedy recovery. Raj had undergone hip replacement surgery last month. This is Fadnavis' first visit to Raj since the surgery.

60.title: Siddaramaiah demands narco test on PSI scam accused ADGP Paul
60.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday demanded a narco test on ADGP Amrit Paul who was arrested in connection with the 2021 Karnataka police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam. "If Amrit Paul...is subjected to...narco test, then it will be clear who all...politicians are involved," Siddaramaiah said. "There should be no attempt to cover up this case," he added.

61.title: Gurugram civic body launches single-use plastic awareness campaign
61.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has launched a campaign to make residents aware about the use of single-use plastic (SUP) items that were banned in the city from July 1. "MCG teams will visit malls, schools...to educate all about the harmful effects of the SUP items," Gurugram mayor Madhu Azad said while launching the campaign at a private school.

62.title: Rare giant deep sea creature caught in Chile, pics go viral
62.article_body: A rare giant sea creature was caught by a group of fishermen in Chile's Arica. It was identified as 16-foot oarfish. Pictures and videos showing a crane hoisting the fish have surfaced on social media. The fish is believed to reside in deep water and surface only during the breeding season or when unwell or dying.

63.title: We'll try our best to win men's hockey gold at CWG 2022: Harmanpreet
63.article_body: Ahead of upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022, Indian men's hockey team vice-captain Harmanpreet Singh said his side will try their best to win a gold medal in Birmingham. "Our team has been performing well. We played well in FIH Hockey Pro League as well," he added. India will face Ghana in their first match of Pool B on July 31.

64.title: Biden must've been drowsy when he threatened Iran: Iranian military
64.article_body: Iranian military has warned the US and Israel against threatening Iran with force. This comes after US President Joe Biden said he's prepared to use force to stop Iran from getting nuclear arms. "Biden must've been drowsy when he threatened Iran," Iranian military spokesman, Brigadier General Abolfazl Shekarchi, said, adding, "Watch your soldiers' pants, they might get wet in...Persian Gulf!"

65.title: Actor Sreejith Ravi, accused of flashing his genitals at 2 children, gets bail
65.article_body: Kerala High Court on Friday granted bail with conditions to actor Sreejith Ravi, arrested in connection with a POCSO case in Thrissur last week. It granted him bail considering the defence argument that Sreejith had been under treatment for behavioural disorder for last six years. He was arrested for allegedly flashing his genitals at two minor girls at a park.

66.title: List of top 10 law colleges in India released by govt
66.article_body: The government has released list of top 10 law colleges in India. National Law School of India University in Bengaluru has been ranked the best law college in India, followed by National Law University in Delhi. Hyderabad's NALSAR University of Law has been ranked third, while Kolkata's The West Bengal National University of Juridical Sciences is fourth on the list.

67.title: Which are the top 10 engineering institutes in India as per govt rankings?
67.article_body: As per the National Institutional Ranking Framework Rankings 2022 released by the Centre on Friday, IIT Madras has been ranked the best institute for engineering in India. IIT Delhi, IIT Bombay, IIT Kanpur and IIT Kharagpur are among the top five engineering institutes. The other top engineering colleges include IIT Roorkee, IIT Guwahati and National Institute of Technology, Tiruchirappalli.

68.title: 2 people arrested while trying to sell countrymade gun in Bengaluru
68.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Thursday said that it has arrested two people from Bihar who were trying to sell a countrymade gun in Bengaluru's Hebbal area. Police seized the pistol and six live rounds from them. While the main accused has been sent to judicial custody, the other person, believed to be a minor, is currently at a juvenile home.

69.title: Govt's 75-day free COVID-19 vaccine booster dose drive for all adults begins today
69.article_body: All adults (aged 18 years and above) will be able to get a free COVID-19 vaccine booster or precautionary shot across India for 75 days starting Friday (July 15). The drive was announced this week, with the Health Ministry urging states and Union Territories to "give an intensive and ambitious push towards full COVID-19 vaccination coverage".

70.title: B'wood will keep sinking as long as it has Kings, Sultans: Vivek Agnihotri
70.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri shared a tweet stating, "Why Shah Rukh Khan is still 'king of Bollywood'" along with an article on the actor. The filmmaker wrote alongside the tweet, "As long as Bollywood has Kings, Badshahs, Sultans, it will keep sinking." He further wrote, "Make it people's industry with people's stories, it will lead the global film industry. #FACT."

71.title: Bloody brilliant: Tamannaah on Kangana's first look as Indira Gandhi
71.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia took to Instagram Stories on Friday to share actress Kangana Ranaut's first look as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the upcoming film 'Emergency'. Tamannaah wrote alongside the poster of 'Emergency', "Bloody brilliant." The film is directed by Kangana and produced under her production house Manikarnika Films along with Renu Pitti.

72.title: SC grants bail to Pune man booked for murder of undertrial on parole
72.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted bail to a man booked for killing another person, who was an undertrial in a murder case and was released from Pune's Yerwada Central Jail on provisional parole due to the COVID-19 outbreak in 2020. The murder of the undertrial prisoner allegedly took place over past enmity, the prosecution said.

73.title: 25 mn children missed out on life-saving vaccines due to COVID: WHO
73.article_body: Around 25 million children in 2021 missed vaccinations to protect them from life-threatening diseases because of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to data published by the WHO and UNICEF. This is two million more than those who missed out on vaccinations in 2020 and six million higher than in the pre-pandemic year 2019, the official data showed.

74.title: Sindhu advances to semis despite losing 1st set at Singapore Open
74.article_body: Indian badminton player PV Sindhu has advanced to the semi-final stage in the women's singles event of the Singapore Open 2022 after defeating China's Han Yue on Friday. Sindhu lost the first set against Yue yet she won the match by 17-21, 21-11 and 21-19. The 27-year-old shuttler will now meet Japan's Saena Kawakami on Saturday.

75.title: Teacher who died 4 years ago included in transfer list in U'khand, probe on
75.article_body: The name of a teacher who allegedly died four years ago was included in a transfer list of Uttarakhand education department. A probe has been ordered into the matter. While talking about the same, state Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat said, "Transfer of deceased teacher has come to fore...which indicates gross negligence of departmental officers towards their functioning and responsibilities."

76.title: Jahangirpuri riots continuation of CAA, NRC protests: Delhi Police
76.article_body: The Jahangirpuri riots that took place in April were in continuation of the Shaheen Bagh protests against the CAA and NRC, and the 2020 north-east Delhi riots, said Delhi Police in a chargesheet. "20 out of 37 accused persons arrested were captured in CCTV footage and viral videos," said the chargesheet, adding that some are still absconding.

77.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe sworn in as Sri Lanka's acting Prez amid crisis
77.article_body: Sri Lanka's Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as the country's acting President on Friday, his office said. Wickremesinghe had already taken on the role after former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country on Wednesday after months of protests. Notably, Sri Lanka's Parliament is scheduled to elect a new President on July 20.

78.title: Union minister unaware of ground realities on MGNREGA in Bengal: BJP
78.article_body: West Bengal's BJP unit claimed Union Minister Kapil Moreshwar Patil is unaware of the ground reality related to MGNREGA in the state. BJP national vice-president Dilip Ghosh alleged that officers have submitted misleading reports to Patil. This comes after Patil claimed that he doesn't know of any corruption in implementation of the scheme at the panchayat level in West Bengal.

79.title: If our kids can go to school at 7 am, why can't SC start at 9 am?: Justice Lalit
79.article_body: A Supreme Court bench on Friday began its sitting an hour earlier than usual, at 9.30 am. Justice UU Lalit, part of the bench and next in line to be Chief Justice of India, said, "Ideally we should sit at 9 [am]." He added, "If our children can go to school at 7 [am]...why can't we come at 9 am?"

80.title: Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner welcome 2nd child
80.article_body:
Joe Jonas and Sophie Turner have welcomed their second child, their representative told media. 
"Joe and Sophie are happy to announce the arrival of their baby girl," the representative stated. Joe and Sophie, who got married in Las Vegas back in 2019, previously welcomed daughter Willa in July 2020.

81.title: I heard story & felt I knew characters that were created: Ruchir on 'Ghar...'
81.article_body: Director Ruchir Arun said that when he heard script of 'Ghar Waapsi', he felt he knew the characters. "I felt like I was born in a house like the one in the story...I knew this father, this mother, the siblings...I knew this city and I knew this world. It was where I was born and I grew up," he added.

82.title: Govt releases list of top 10 medical colleges in India
82.article_body: As per the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) Rankings 2022, All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi has been named the best medical college in the country. It is followed by Chandigarh's Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research and Vellore's Christian Medical College. National Institute of Mental Health & Neuro Sciences, Bangalore is ranked fourth.

83.title: Let's be happy for them: Sushmita's ex-boyfriend Rohman on actress dating Lalit Modi
83.article_body: Sushmita Sen's ex-boyfriend Rohman Shawl has reacted to the actress dating former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi. "Let's be happy for them...Love is beautiful. All I know is if she has chosen someone, he is worth it!" he stated. Lalit Modi had shared pictures with Sushmita on Thursday and called her his "better looking partner".

84.title: KK's wife Jyothy Krishna paints a picture of late singer, shares it
84.article_body: KK's wife Jyothy Krishna has painted a picture of the late singer and posted it on social media. "Trying to paint again, Miss you sweetheart," she wrote with photo of the painting. KK passed away in May this year, after suffering a cardiac arrest in Kolkata after his performance.

85.title: RP Singh questions Kohli's absence from WI tour, says 'No one asked if we wanted to rest'
85.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has questioned Virat Kohli's absence from West Indies tour. He said, "When a player is going through a bad patch...he won't ask for rest. He should play more games as taking rest won't help him return to form." He added, "[During my time], no one asked if we wanted to rest...you either got selected or dropped."

86.title: Quite refreshing to know that Virat Kohli is a human: Jos Buttler
86.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli amid his poor form, England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said, "It's quite refreshing for the rest of us [to know] that Kohli is a human and he can have a couple of low scores as well." Buttler added, "Kohli has been one of the best players...if not the best player in ODI cricket in the world."

87.title: Union Minister shares video of Goa's Dudhsagar Falls, says 'Heaven meets Earth'
87.article_body: Union Minister G Kishan Reddy took to social media to share a video of Goa's Dudhsagar Falls. "Heaven meets Earth...It is one of the most beautiful scenic spots in the country. If you want to be smitten by nature's own miracle, visit the place for unforgettable memories!" he wrote. "It is wonderful nature's gift," a social media user commented.

88.title: Alt News' Mohammed Zubair granted bail in 2018 tweet case
88.article_body: Fact-checker and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair has been granted bail by a Delhi court in connection with the case over his 2018 tweet in which he allegedly hurt religious sentiments. Zubair will, however, remain in jail over two cases filed in Uttar Pradesh. The court said that the 33-year-old cannot leave the country without prior permission from the court.

89.title: It is a tough film to make: Anil Kapoor on Abhinav Bindra's biopic
89.article_body: Anil Kapoor has reacted to rumours claiming his upcoming movie based on the life of Olympic gold-medalist Abhinav Bindra has been shelved. "Bindra was always happening...but it's a tough film to make...It needs a lot of planning," he said. "All good filmmakers work on scripts for years to make them happen," Anil said, adding, "I plan to start...[it] by 2023."

90.title: Waiting for approval: B'luru school booked for running 'illegally'
90.article_body: Days after Bengaluru's Orchids International School was booked for illegally functioning without approval and authorisation, the school said they have sought necessary permissions from the state education department. "We're hopeful to receive the permission shortly," it said in a statement. The Block Education Officer said it is doubtful the school would be allowed to function this academic year.

91.title: Govt releases list of top 10 management institutes in India
91.article_body: The government on Friday released the NIRF Ranking 2022 for management institutes, with Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad emerging as the top management institute in the country. It was followed by IIM Bangalore, IIM Calcutta, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi and IIM Kozhikode. IIM Lucknow has been ranked 6th, IIM Indore 7th and XLRI Jamshedpur 8th.

92.title: Will prove our position in court & we believe we'll prevail: Twitter CEO to staff
92.article_body: Following a lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion acquisition agreement, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told his staff, "We will prove our position in court and we believe we will prevail." Twitter's lawsuit has accused Musk of "a long list" of violations of the merger agreement that "cast a pall over Twitter and its business".

93.title: 3 men arrested for gangrape of 16-year-old girl in a moving car in Delhi
93.article_body: Three men have been arrested over alleged gangrape of a 16-year-old girl in a moving car, police said on Friday. The Class 10 girl reportedly told the police that she was in a market with two of the men, who spiked her drink and took her into a car brought by the third accused. The accused reportedly recorded the crime.

94.title: Oscar-winning make-up artist said I resemble Indira Gandhi a lot: Kangana
94.article_body: Kangana Ranaut said Oscar-winning make-up artist David Malinowski, who worked on her look for the upcoming film 'Emergency', pointed out that she "physically [resembles] Mrs (Indira) Gandhi a lot, including...skin texture and jawline". "I told him in India, people believe I'm the perfect person to play Mrs Gandhi," she added. Kangana further said David and his team are astute professionals.

95.title: Dropping Willey's catch was key moment: Giles on India's loss by 100 runs
95.article_body: After India lost to England by 100 runs on Thursday, former English spinner Ashley Giles said that India dropping the catch of England's David Willey was a "key moment" in the match. "Willey was on 1 and went on to get 40-odd at close to a run-a-ball...Both Willey and Reece Topley upfront carried that momentum into India's batting," Giles said.

96.title: Europe shot itself in the lungs with Russia sanctions: Hungary PM
96.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said Europe has "shot itself in the lungs" by imposing sanctions on Russia over Ukraine war. "The sanctions don't help Ukraine, however, they're bad for the European economy and if it goes on like this, they'll kill off the European economy," he added. "The sanctions policy was based on wrong assumptions and...must be changed," he said.

97.title: PMC to take action against contractors over potholes on roads
97.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to take action against contractors responsible for the roads built before the monsoon season which have now developed potholes. A list of the affected roads has been prepared, PMC Additional Municipal Commissioner (Estate) Kunal Khemnar said. "PMC should ask...contractors responsible to clear these potholes and also impose a fine on them," he added.

98.title: Body of Telangana journalist who was washed away in floodwaters found
98.article_body: The body of a Telangana journalist who went missing after his car was washed away in flood waters in Jagtial district has been found. His body was found after a rescue operation that lasted for over 48 hours. Reports said that his body was found stuck in a tree. The rescue team also pulled out a badly mangled car.

99.title: Probe ordered against 33 govt schools in J'khand for giving weekly off on Friday
99.article_body: A probe has been ordered against 33 government schools in Jharkhand's Dumka for giving Friday as their weekly off instead of Sunday. "We've written...to Block education officers...All the schools have 'Urdu' in their names," an official said. "It's being investigated how Urdu is tied to these institutions...under what conditions a weekly holiday on Friday is being offered," the official added.

100.title: Cyberabad police shares accident video, says 'Don't jump divider'
100.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police shared a video of an accident that took place in Narsingi and urged people to not cross the road from median bushes and by jumping the divider. "Fortunately, pedestrian survived with simple injuries," the traffic police said. The video shows a pedestrian getting hit by a car after he jumped over the road median.

101.title: Rohit struggles against swinging deliveries of left-arm seamers: Jaffer
101.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer has said that Indian skipper Rohit Sharma struggles against "left-arm seamers when the ball swings". "Reece Topley bowled really well. Even the shot Rohit played before he got out was loose as well," Jaffer said. "Shikhar Dhawan still looks rusty. He hasn't found his touch because he hasn't played a lot of cricket," he added.

102.title: Military use outdated, solve issues peacefully: Dalai Lama tells India, China
102.article_body: The Dalai Lama on Friday advocated a peaceful resolution to the ongoing tensions between India and China along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in eastern Ladakh. "India and China are both competitive nations and neighbours, sooner or later you have to solve this problem through talks and peaceful means. The use of military force is outdated," Dalai Lama said.

103.title: Govt releases advisory as India reports its 1st case of monkeypox
103.article_body: The government has released an advisory after India's first monkeypox case was reported in Kerala. Government said people travelling abroad should avoid contact with sick people, including those with skin and genital lesions. "Avoid contact with dead rats, squirrels and monkeys," government added. "Consult nearest health facility if you develop symptoms suggestive of monkeypox," it further said.

104.title: If kids can go to school at 7 am, SC can start at 9 am: Justice Lalit
104.article_body: Justice Uday Umesh Lalit said if kids can go to school at 7 am, the Supreme Court judges and lawyers can also start their day at 9 am. He began hearing cases an hour before the usual time on Friday. Justice Lalit earlier said SC benches should start at 9 am and rise at 11.30 am for a half-hour break.

105.title: Initially I thought the makers were just kidding: Mithali on 'Shabaash...'
105.article_body: Discussing 'Shabaash Mithu' which is a biopic on her, ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj said, "Initially, I thought [the makers] were...kidding, but when...[they] told me in detail, I realised this is reality." "[The film] has been an emotional ride," read a tweet from Mithali. "Cricket wasn't a part of my vision. It was dad's decision," Mithali had shared.

106.title: WB man kills brother for 'abusing' mother in front of neighbours
106.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stabbing his brother to death on Thursday to keep their mother's "honour" in West Bengal's Murshidabad. Reportedly, the deceased had abused his mother in front of neighbours when she refused to give him money to buy alcohol. The accused asked the deceased to stop but the latter paid no heed, a neighbour claimed.

107.title: Twitter-Musk case to be overseen by Delaware business court's 1st female chief judge
107.article_body: The first female chief judge on Delaware’s business court will oversee Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating the $44 billion acquisition agreement. Kathaleen McCormick took over the role of chancellor, or chief judge, last year. McCormick's final ruling on the merger can be appealed to the Delaware Supreme Court.

108.title: Unable to pay for hotel, Lonavala man steals ₹1.2 lakh from colleague, held
108.article_body: MIDC Police have arrested a man from Lonavala for allegedly stealing ₹1.2 lakh from his colleague after he was unable to pay for two hotel rooms where he and his family stayed for 15 days. Reports said that the man would spend his salary on shopping and alcohol and would later rely on his siblings.

109.title: China willing to recalibrate ties with Australia: Foreign Min
109.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi has said that China is willing to "recalibrate" its relationship with Australia after several years of tensions over national security and trade. He added that Australia should "correct" its understanding of China for relations to set sail again and also refrain from joining in with others in trying to contain China.

110.title: Will is gay & he does love Mike: Noah on his Stranger Things' character
110.article_body: 'Stranger Things' actor Noah Schnapp confirmed that his character Will Byers is gay on the show. He added Will is in love with his friend Mike Wheeler, played by Finn Wolfhard, but doesn't want to hurt Eleven's feelings by confessing it. Noah further said Will is scared to come out and doesn't know if he'll be accepted by his friends.

111.title: Sanjeev was rejected for Khana Khazana, channel said 'We want woman': Hansal
111.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta revealed that ZeeTV had initially declined to take Sanjeev Kapoor as the host of their cookery show, 'Khana Khazana'. "They said, 'We want a woman. Housewives want someone relatable, a woman cooking, not a man'," he added. Hansal further said the show did not take off with the female chef-host.

112.title: Bihar woman stabbed in eyes while resisting rape by neighbour
112.article_body: A 45-year-old woman in Bihar's Katihar was allegedly stabbed in both eyes with a pointed wooden or iron object as she resisted a rape attempt by a neighbour. The incident took place when the accused took her away while she slept in her mud-and-thatched house with her 11-year-old daughter. "Her retina is damaged...The woman can barely see," said a doctor.

113.title: US House passes amendment approving sanctions waiver to India over Russia deal
113.article_body: The US House of Representatives has passed by voice vote a legislative amendment that approves waiver to India against the CAATSA sanctions for its purchase of the S-400 missile defence system from Russia. However, this is not yet a part of the law. The amendment was introduced by Indian-American Congressman Ro Khanna.

114.title: He has never been more desperate to score: Ojha after Kohli's 16(25)
114.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said Virat Kohli has "never been more desperate to score runs" following his dismissal for 16 off 25 balls in the second ODI against England. "There's been a lot of talk around his lack of form and he...would also be thinking about it a lot," added Ojha. "Kohli [is] chasing the outside off deliveries," he stated.

115.title: SC rejects plea for probe into 'extra-judicial' killings of Chhattisgarh tribals
115.article_body: Supreme Court dismissed a 2009 petition seeking a probe into alleged extra-judicial killings of 17 tribals by security forces during anti-Naxal operations in Chhattisgarh. A tribal rights activist had filed a PIL seeking an independent investigation into the killings. "We're not proceeding with perjury...it's open to the state government to include charges like criminal conspiracy etc," SC stated.

116.title: IndiGo Delhi-Vadodara flight diverted to Jaipur after glitch in engine
116.article_body: An IndiGo flight from Delhi to Vadodara was diverted to Jaipur on Thursday night. The diversion was a precautionary measure following vibrations in the engine for a fraction of a second. An alternate flight was arranged for the onward journey of the passengers. Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said that they have ordered a probe into the matter.

117.title: SP-ally OP Rajbhar's party to support NDA's Prez candidate Droupadi Murmu
117.article_body: Om Prakash Rajbhar's Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP), an ally of the Akhilesh Yadav-led Samajwadi Party (SP), announced on Friday that it will be supporting NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the Presidential elections. "The decision was taken after discussions with party leaders and office bearers," Rajbhar said. Notably, Akhilesh Yadav is supporting Yashwant Sinha for Presidential polls.

118.title: Govt releases list of top 10 universities in India
118.article_body: The Ministry of Education on Friday released the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) Rankings 2022, according to which Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru has attained the first position. JNU, Delhi has been ranked second, followed by Jamia Millia Islamia, Delhi, Jadavpur University, Kolkata, Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, Coimbatore and Banaras Hindu University, Varanasi.

119.title: Which are the top 10 colleges in India according to 2022 rankings released by govt?
119.article_body: According to the NIRF India Rankings 2022, Miranda House-Delhi has been ranked 1st in 'College' category, followed by Hindu College-Delhi, Presidency College-Chennai, Loyola College-Chennai and Lady Shri Ram College for Women-Delhi. PSGR Krishnammal College for Women-Coimbatore has been ranked 6th, Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College-Delhi (7th) and St Xavier's College-Kolkata (8th).

120.title: Man kills and boils his wife in front of his 6 children in Pakistan
120.article_body: A man has allegedly killed and boiled his wife in a cauldron in front of his six children in Pakistan's Sindh province. Police said they found Nargis' body in a cauldron in the kitchen of a private school, where her husband Ashiq worked as a watchman. The police said the victim's 15-year-old daughter called them.

121.title: Wife Sunita is preparing but I have done no prep: Anil on being a grandparent
121.article_body: Soon-to-be grandfather actor Anil Kapoor said his wife Sunita Kapoor is preparing for the role of being a grandparent but that he has done no preparation. "I think this is a role...I can't prepare for. I have to be very spontaneous about it...I really want D-Day to happen, and then I'll tell you how I feel about it," he added.

122.title: Tried hitting Messi to bring him down but failed to stop him: Del Piero
122.article_body: Juventus legend Alessandro Del Piero said he tried "hitting" Lionel Messi in order to bring him down during a match but failed to stop him. "He was unbelievable," added Del Piero. "It was something very beautiful to see," he stated. "Messi is the very essence of football and we're lucky that he's playing in our time," Del Piero had shared.

123.title: Sweden hands life sentence to ex-Iranian official over prison executions
123.article_body: A Swedish court has sentenced a former Iranian official to life in prison for participating in the mass execution and torture of political prisoners in Iran in 1988. Hamid Nouri was arrested at a Stockholm airport in 2019 and was tried under the principle of universal jurisdiction. Iran said that "Nouri's sentence was politically motivated and...has no legal validity".

124.title: Would've been great if tri-series was played among Ind, Eng, SA: Jaffer
124.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that it would have been "great for fans" had a tri-series between India, England and South Africa was scheduled instead of the ongoing bilateral series. "SA are in England. Their ODI series starts on 19th July. England-India ODI series finishes on 17th July...this could have been a really good tri-series," Jaffer tweeted.

125.title: Jewellery worth ₹13 lakh stolen from Air Force officer's house in Chandigarh
125.article_body: Police have registered a case after jewellery worth ₹13 lakh was found stolen from an Air Force officer's house in Chandigarh. Pratima Mishra, wife of Wing Commander Hemant Kumar Mishra, said she lived with her two daughters at their house in Sector-49. Pratima has raised suspicion on her domestic help as she did not report to work on multiple days.

126.title: Shameful: SC to Nagaland for delaying women's reservation in local bodies
126.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday criticised Nagaland government for delaying the implementation of 33% reservation for women in urban local bodies, saying, "It's shameful to defeat the [rights] of women like this." Noting that the state had made a law for the reservation in 2016, the bench added, "We've no trust in the state government...How can any welfare state do this?"

127.title: Scored double century despite immense pain: Gavaskar on 1971 WI tour
127.article_body: Discussing India's last Test against West Indies during their tour of West Indies in 1971, Sunil Gavaskar said, "Ice got into the cavity of my tooth and it was so painful!" "[I was forbidden] from taking...sleeping tablets or any painkillers...I...[got a double hundred in the second innings having scored] a century in the first innings as well," he added.

128.title: Actor-director Pratap Pothen found dead at his home in Chennai
128.article_body: Actor-director Pratap Pothen was found dead in his apartment in Chennai on Friday. A police officer said that as per initial reports he had died of natural health causes and Kilpauk Police will investigate the case further. The 69-year-old had worked in more than 100 films in Tamil, Malayalam, Telugu and Hindi.

129.title: JEE Main 2022 topper Navya says he will retake exam
129.article_body: Navya Hisaria, who scored 100 percentile in the Joint Engineering Examination (JEE) Main 2022 session 1, has said he will retake the exam. "These JEE Main attempts teach me how to complete the paper within the given timeframe and manage the time well. It is like a practice," he further said.

130.title: 3 injured in clash between 2 communities over biryani shop in UP
130.article_body: Three people were injured after a clash took place between members of two communities when a municipal corporation team was clearing encroachment by a biryani shop in the Prem Nagar area of Bareilly, UP. The shop owner Nawab Ali and a local BJP leader Ankit Bhatia got into an argument, which later turned violent, during the anti-encroachment drive, police said.

131.title: Musk's father confirms 2nd child with stepdaughter, says 'We're on Earth to reproduce'
131.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk's father, Errol, has revealed that he welcomed a second child with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout, in 2019. Errol, 76, who already has a five-year-old boy with Jana, said, "The only thing we're on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol said that they are no longer living together owing to their 41-year age gap.

132.title: Sushmita Sen's 11-yr-old tweet thanking Lalit Modi for 'blue tick' on Twitter goes viral
132.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen's 11-year-old tweet thanking former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi for helping her get blue verification tick on Twitter is going viral. "Yippppeeee!!! Finally my twitter acc is verified!! Thank you Lalit(Modi):) for all your help! Sooooo much for a tick mark;) party time," she had tweeted. Earlier, Lalit Modi confirmed that they are in a relationship.

133.title: Was repeatedly told to introduce songs, fights: Madhavan on 'Rocketry...'
133.article_body: Discussing his recent film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' which is a biopic on former scientist Nambi Narayanan, R Madhavan said, "I was repeatedly told to introduce songs and fights into Nambi sir's story." "Can you imagine Nambi sir singing and dancing and fighting? Sorry, I would have preferred to not make the film rather than dilute [his] story," added Madhavan.

134.title: This isn't Germany: Kamal Haasan on 'unparliamentary' words list
134.article_body: Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) chief Kamal Haasan in a statement on Thursday condemned the list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, saying, "Mr Hitler, this isn't Germany!" He questioned if the PM and his ministers aren't open to criticism, then does it mean "we're going back to [a] monarchy where...king and his ministers would be only praised?"

135.title: HMDA to build Landscape Park worth ₹35 cr near Hyderabad's Osman Sagar
135.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) is planning to build a Landscape Park near Osman Sagar, at a cost of around ₹35.60 crore. Spread over an area of 5.5 acres, the park is expected to be completed by Dussehra this year. The facility will also have a food court, restrooms, a children's play area, picnic areas and inner access roads.

136.title: Mumbai civic body to prepare SOP with BEST, MSRTC for stranded commuters
136.article_body: Mumbai civic commissioner IS Chahal has directed the officials to prepare an SOP with Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport and Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation to prevent commuters from getting stranded. Chahal asked officials to provide first aid assistance as well. The decision was taken following CM Eknath Shinde's directions on the same due to Mumbai's incessant rains.

137.title: Musk's father welcomes 2nd child with stepdaughter, says 'We are on Earth to reproduce’
137.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk’s father, Errol, has revealed that he welcomed a second child with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout in 2019. Errol, 76, who already has a five-year-old boy with Jana, said "The only thing we're on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol said that they are no longer living together owing to their 41-year age gap.

138.title: Trying to save her: Assam CM on teen arrested over 'anti-national' poem
138.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday said that the 19-year-old college student, Barshashree Buragohain, was arrested for wanting to join the militant group ULFA(I) and not for posting an "anti-national" poem. "She is our daughter. We're trying to save her," he added. "If her parents...take responsibility that she will not join ULFA(I), she will be released," Sarma stated.

139.title: 'Over mature' 150-yr-old heritage tree uprooted from Chandigarh school
139.article_body: A 150-year-old heritage tree, after being deemed "over mature" in a survey, has been uprooted from Chandigarh's Vatika School for Deaf and Dumb Children. This came after another heritage tree had recently fallen in another city school, causing death of one student and injuries to several others. The tree had been earlier pruned, an official said.

140.title: Belgian Deputy PM resigns to take care of ill husband
140.article_body: Belgian Deputy PM and Foreign Minister, Sophie Wilmes, has resigned to take care of her husband, former Australian footballer Chris Stone, who has been diagnosed with brain cancer. She'd temporarily stepped down in April for the same reason. "My husband's illness will be a difficult battle that I want to fight alongside him and...our children," Wilmes said in a statement.

141.title: Kangana Ranaut reveals first look as Indira Gandhi for 'Emergency'
141.article_body: The teaser of 'Emergency' was unveiled on Thursday, revealing Kangana Ranaut's look as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi for the upcoming project. "Presenting 'Her' who was called 'Sir'," Kangana wrote while sharing the teaser on her Instagram handle and added that she has started shooting for the film. In addition to acting in it, Kangana is also directing the film.

142.title: Schools to remain closed today & tomorrow in Pimpri Chinchwad
142.article_body: All civic and private schools will remain closed today and tomorrow in Pimpri Chinchwad as per the District Collector's directives, PCMC Deputy Commissioner Sandip Khot said. "We have over 650 civic and private schools," he added. However, the PMC said that schools in its area will remain open today. This comes as the Pune district has been witnessing heavy rainfall.

143.title: Complete dictatorship: O Panneerselvam after AIADMK expels OP Ravindhranath
143.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam has termed AIADMK's decision of expelling his son and Theni Lok Sabha MP OP Ravindhranath "complete dictatorship". "In...last General Election 2019, OP Ravindhranath won and that is the only seat where AIADMK won. Removing [him] is a complete dictatorship," said O Panneerselvam. His other son, VP Jayapradeep, was also expelled from AIADMK on Thursday.

144.title: Like all firms, we are not immune to economic headwinds: Google CEO to staff
144.article_body: In an internal memo to the staff, Google CEO Sundar Pichai while announcing the company’s plan to slow its hiring, said, "Like all companies, we’re not immune to economic headwinds". He added, “The uncertain global economic outlook has been top of mind...We’ve never viewed these types of challenges as obstacles. Instead, we’ve seen them as opportunities to deepen our focus."

145.title: Google to slow hiring for rest of the year: CEO Pichai tells employees
145.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai in an internal memo to the staff has announced that they will be "slowing down the pace of hiring for the rest of the year" amid an uncertain global economic outlook. He added, Google will focus on hiring for "critical roles" and will be "pausing development" in some cases and "re-deploying resources to higher priority areas".

146.title: Only regret not winning the WC, wish I could replay 2017 WC final: Mithali
146.article_body: Ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj has tweeted she only regrets not winning the World Cup, adding she wishes she could replay the ICC Women's World Cup 2017 final, which India lost against England. "[I wish I could] take the team across the line and lift that trophy," added Mithali. England defeated India by nine runs in the final.

147.title: Actress Constance Wu reveals she attempted suicide after 'internet shaming' in 2019
147.article_body: Actress Constance Wu, best known for her role in 'Crazy Rich Asians', has revealed that she attempted suicide after facing social media backlash over her "careless" tweets in 2019. She said that the tweets "ignited outrage and internet shaming that got pretty severe". "Luckily, a friend found me and rushed me to the ER," she further said.

148.title: Life with mom was a fantasy, haven't dealt with her loss: Janhvi on Sridevi
148.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said living when her mother and late actress Sridevi was around was a fantasy and she has not dealt with her loss completely. "The reality that I am living now is so anchored. It feels secure only because of Arjun Bhaiya and Anshula didi...it almost hurts to remember the person...I was because it was different," she added.

149.title: US lawyer, accused of plotting his own death, charged with wife & son's murder
149.article_body: US lawyer Alex Murdaugh has been charged with the murder of his wife and son. Murdaugh's wife Margaret and son Paul were killed on June 7, 2021. Almost three months after their deaths, Murdaugh was arrested and charged for allegedly planning his own killing so that his surviving son, Buster Murdaugh, could receive a $10 million insurance payout.

150.title: Ajmer Dargah cleric arrested from Hyderabad for provocative speech
150.article_body: The Rajasthan Police arrested an Ajmer Dargah cleric (khadim) from Hyderabad for allegedly delivering a provocative speech shortly before a rally being taken out against the former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma last month. The accused, Gohar Chishti, will be brought to Ajmer on transit remand, police said. Notably, four others, who were there at the rally, have also been arrested.

151.title: Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker accepts Rajapaksa's resignation
151.article_body: Sri Lanka's Parliamentary Speaker on Friday said that he has accepted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation letter after verifying its authenticity. "From this point, we will move to constitutionally appoint a new President," Speaker Mahinda Abeywardena added. Rajapaksa resigned on Thursday after fleeing to Singapore amid mass protests over the ongoing economic crisis in the island nation.

152.title: Leptospirosis cases could rise in Mumbai, take treatment if infected: BMC
152.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has warned that leptospirosis cases could rise due to the heavy rainfall that has been lashing the city. According to reports, BMC has also asked people to not wade in water. "If exposed, take prophylactic treatment (such as doxycycline/azithromycin) as per medical advice," an advisory from the civic body reportedly said.

153.title: Kerala becomes the only state with its own internet service: CM Vijayan
153.article_body: Kerala has become the only state in India with its own internet service, CM Pinarayi Vijayan said on Thursday. "The Kerala Fiber Optic Network Limited has received the ISP license from the Centre's Department of Telecommunications," he added. With this, Kerala's KFON project can kickstart its operations of providing internet as a basic right to our people, Vijayan further said.

154.title: Babar is way ahead of Kohli, can't understand comparisons: Imam Ul Haq
154.article_body: Pakistan opener Imam Ul Haq said Babar Azam is "way ahead" of Virat Kohli currently, adding he can't understand comparisons between them. "At the end of their careers, I want Babar to score three to four thousand runs more than Kohli in every format," added Imam. "I feel that [Kohli doesn't have the same talent as Rohit Sharma]," he stated.

155.title: Massive fire breaks out at restaurant in Delhi's Connaught Place
155.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a restaurant 'Cafe High5' in Connaught Place's Outer Circle in Delhi. "Total of six fire tenders were rushed to the site. Fire is brought under control and so far no one is injured," Delhi Fire Service officials said. Reportedly, the fire occurred in a piece of furniture in the restaurant on the first floor.

156.title: India reports 20,038 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,39,073
156.article_body: India has reported 20,038 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 20,139 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,39,073, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,604, according to the latest data.

157.title: No plans for company-wide layoffs: Twitter amid lawsuit against Musk
157.article_body: In a filing, Twitter has said that it isn't looking at company-wide layoffs but could continue to restructure the business. The filing comes a day after it sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal. In May, Twitter said it would pause hiring and review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".

158.title: Live with parents, wanted to write what I can do in front of them: Amit Tandon
158.article_body: Comedian Amit Tandon said he has done "edgy" stuff before but he lives with his parents so he wanted to write what he could do in front of them too. "However, like movies, comedy too has all kinds of genres. And while some of them you'd love watching with family, others you can watch alone with headphones on," he added.

159.title: We'll break records, everyone will vote for Murmu: Maha CM Shinde
159.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde claimed on Thursday that in the upcoming Presidential polls, all records will be broken as everyone will vote for NDA's candidate, Droupadi Murmu, under PM Narendra Modi's guidance. "Murmu is a tribal woman. We work for tribals and we support tribal people," he said. Murmu had met Shinde and other leaders the same day.

160.title: Reece Topley records best-ever bowling figures by an England bowler in men's ODI history
160.article_body: England fast bowler Reece Topley on Thursday recorded the best-ever bowling figures by an England bowler in men's ODI cricket history. The 28-year-old registered figures of 9.5-2-24-6 against India in the second ODI at Lord's to break the record. The previous record was held by Paul Collingwood, who recorded figures of 10-1-31-6 against Bangladesh in an ODI in 2005.

161.title: Dhanush attends The Gray Man premiere with sons Linga & Yathra, shares pics
161.article_body: Actor Dhanush attended the premiere of 'The Gray Man' in Los Angeles on Wednesday, along with his sons Linga and Yathra. He shared some pictures from the premiere on his Instagram handle and wrote, "When you realise they've completely stolen the show from you. At #TheGrayMan premiere with Yathra, Linga." Dhanush plays an assassin named Avik San in the film.

162.title: 17-yr-old Mumbai boy blows off courier parcel to claim insurance, detained
162.article_body: Mumbai Police have detained a 17-year-old boy for allegedly blowing off a courier parcel to avail insurance benefits. Reports said that the minor had booked a courier service to Delhi on the pretext of sending a consignment of electronics, claiming to be valued at ₹9.81 lakh. Reports added that he had packed the courier with junk and an incendiary device.

163.title: Rupee edges closer to 80 per US dollar, opens at record low of 79.94
163.article_body: The rupee on Friday opened at a record low of 79.94 against the US dollar. So far this year, the US dollar is up 7% against the Indian currency. On Thursday, the currency had closed at another record low of 79.90 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex jumped 316 points to 53,733 in Friday's early session.

164.title: Why is this discussion happening, I can't understand: Rohit to journalist on Kohli's form
164.article_body: After a journalist started his question on Virat Kohli saying that a lot of discussion is happening over Kohli's form, India captain Rohit Sharma responded, "Why is this discussion happening, I can't understand." Rohit added that Kohli doesn't need reassurance as he is a great batter. "He only needs one or two good innings to bounce back," Rohit further stated.

165.title: What is 'Turkey teeth', the dental trend UK doctors have warned people against?
165.article_body: UK doctors have warned people against "Turkey teeth", the dental trend that involves travelling abroad to get cut-price treatment. The procedure is leaving hundreds of Britishers with serious complications. It involves filing the teeth to pegs and then replacing them with crowns or veneers. Patients can choose the shape, material and colour of these caps.

166.title: Wore every piece of clothing I had, lips turned blue: Janhvi on trip with Sara
166.article_body: While talking about a trip that she took with actress Sara Ali Khan, actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she wore every piece of clothing she had on the trip and that her lips turned blue from the cold weather. "I had travelled to Kedarnath with two thermals, one puffer jacket, three shawls, two-track pants and two sweaters," she added.

167.title: Elon has a real record of success: LinkedIn Co-founder defends Musk against Trump
167.article_body: LinkedIn's billionaire Co-founder Reid Hoffman defended Tesla CEO Elon Musk after former US President Donald Trump called the former a "bullshit artist" over the $44 billion Twitter deal. Hoffman tweeted, "Elon's a classic American immigrant story- an entrepreneur with a real record of success…[Whereas] Trump is a spoiled rich kid who bankrupts everything he touches. Including the US economy."

168.title: I am done being called a diva or fashionista: Nia Sharma
168.article_body: Actress Nia Sharma, known for shows like 'Naagin' and 'Twisted 2', has said she wants people to recognise her as an artist now, adding that she's done being called a diva or a fashionista or someone who's known for her looks. Nia further said she wants to be known as someone "who can instantly be considered for a performance-oriented role".

169.title: 2 held for stealing lorry carrying ₹38 lakh-soap bars: Rachakonda Police
169.article_body: Two interstate offenders were arrested for allegedly stealing a lorry which was carrying soap bars worth over ₹38 lakh from Maheshwaram, the Rachakonda Police tweeted on Friday. The accused along with two others had decided to steal the goods by diverting the vehicles delivering them, according to the police. The lorry, worth ₹15 lakh, was also recovered, the police said.

170.title: Removal of Mangalsutra by wife is mental cruelty of highest order: High Court
170.article_body: While granting divorce to a couple, Madras High Court has observed that removal of 'thali' (Mangalsutra) by a wife would amount to subjecting husband to mental cruelty of the highest order. "Thali around the neck of a woman was a sacred thing which symbolises the continuance of married life and it's removed only after the husband's death," the court said.

171.title: 105 kg red sandalwood worth ₹3.15 lakh seized in B'luru; 1 arrested
171.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly smuggling 105 kg red sandalwood worth about ₹3.15 lakh in Bengaluru's Kengeri on Thursday. The seizure was made after the police stopped a red car at a regular checkpoint. While one person was taken into custody, the police are trying to catch the others who managed to escape while being questioned.

172.title: BBMP ex-corporator's husband stabbed to death over mosque presidentship
172.article_body: BBMP ex-corporator Nazima Khanam's husband died on Thursday after being stabbed by his nephew over the issue of heading a mosque committee. According to Khanam, her husband, Ayub Khan, was the President of a mosque in Bengaluru's Tippu Nagar for last 15 years. However, Ayub's nephew wanted to be the President which regularly led to arguments between them, Khanam added.

173.title: Dalit gang-rape survivor run over by bike in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, loses leg
173.article_body: A Dalit gang-rape survivor from Uttar Pradesh's Mathura lost her left leg after she was allegedly run over by a bike by the accused and was left abandoned near a railway track. After an FIR was filed, two of the accused were arrested. They made her consume an intoxicant before allegedly raping her while she was going to a bank.

174.title: Govt mulls imposing fines for not wearing masks in Bengaluru
174.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar has said that the government is considering imposing fines on people not wearing masks in public places in Bengaluru. "I feel that masks have to be made compulsory at least in Bengaluru," he said. "We may have to think about imposing fines on people also before it gets out of hand," he added.

175.title: 65-year-old woman robbed, murdered at her home in Pune; 1 booked
175.article_body: A case has been filed against one person after a 65-year-old woman was robbed and murdered at her house in Pune's Katraj. The accused allegedly strangled the deceased, who lived alone, to death and stole the jewellery she was wearing along with some cash from the house.
