The incident occurred on the intervening night of July 11 and July 12.

176.title: Elon Musk's mother shares pics from his startup Zip2's opening event from 1997
176.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's mother Maye Musk took to Twitter to share pictures of the opening of Zip2's global headquarters in Mountain View, California, in 1997. Zip2, a web software startup that created online city guides for newspapers, was the first company founded by Elon Musk. Earlier, a picture of Musk's 1995 business card of Zip2 went viral on Twitter.

177.title: It's been for a long time: Rohit on long tail in batting being an issue
177.article_body: Talking about whether India's long tail in batting is an issue, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "That has been...for a long time now...We do understand we have a long tail." England defeated India by 100 runs in the second ODI with Rohit dismissed for a duck. "Not that the target [of 247] wasn't chaseable...We just didn't bat well," added Rohit.

178.title: Ripudaman Singh Malik, acquitted in 1985 Air India bombing, shot dead in Canada
178.article_body: Ripudaman Singh Malik, who was acquitted in the 1985 Air India Kanishka bombing case, was shot dead in Canada's British Columbia on Thursday, Canadian news outlets reported. Witness said that three shots were heard and Malik was hit in the neck. The bombing took place in Montreal-Delhi Air India Flight 182, Emperor Kanishka, in 1985, killing all 329 onboard.

179.title: Italian President rejects PM Mario Draghi’s resignation
179.article_body: Italian President Sergio Mattarella has rejected the resignation of the country's PM Mario Draghi. The former head of the European Central Bank had tendered his resignation after populist coalition partner Five Star withdrew its support in a confidence vote, which he won. President Mattarella has also asked Draghi to address Parliament to provide a clear picture of the political situation.

180.title: 159 kids rescued from begging under Operation Muskaan in Hyderabad
180.article_body: A total of 159 children were rescued from begging on Hyderabad streets under the eighth phase of 'Operation Muskaan'. Out of these, 135 were boys and 24 were girls hailing from several states, Hyderabad City Police informed on Thursday. Further, 12 FIRs were registered against shop owners where children aged between five and 18 years were working, police added.

181.title: Twitter uses Musk's old poop reaction to CEO's tweet as evidence in court, he reacts
181.article_body: Twitter has used Tesla CEO Elon Musk's poop reaction to one of CEO Parag Agrawal's tweets on spam accounts in May as evidence against him in court. The Twitter lawsuit alleged that Musk has repeatedly disparaged Twitter and created business risk for the company. Meanwhile, reacting to this, Musk used another poop emoji and wrote, "= bs".

182.title: IMD issues orange alert for Pune for Friday; rainfall intensity to reduce
182.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an orange alert for Pune for Friday. "Rainfall intensity over most parts of Maharashtra will reduce from Friday onwards," IMD said. Some parts of Pune recorded 70 mm of rainfall on Thursday, the season's highest so far, IMD added. Southwest Monsoon will remain active over west, central and peninsular India till July 18, IMD stated.

183.title: Pakistan captain Babar Azam's 'Stay strong' tweet for Virat Kohli goes viral
183.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam took to Twitter to write in support of Virat Kohli amid the latter's poor form. Sharing a picture of himself with Kohli, Babar wrote, "This too shall pass. Stay strong." Kohli was dismissed for 16(25) in the second ODI against England after having scored 12 runs in the two T20Is against England.

184.title: Rohit dislocates his elbow, pops it back in himself while fielding; video goes viral
184.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma dislocating his elbow and popping it back in himself while fielding in the second ODI against England at Lord's. In the video, Rohit can be seen having a laugh with Jadeja after popping his elbow back in. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Rohit giving orthopaedic lessons while playing."

185.title: Ivana Trump, first wife of Donald Trump, passes away
185.article_body: Ivana Trump, former US President Donald Trump's first wife and the mother of three of his children, has died aged 73. "She was a wonderful, beautiful, and amazing woman, who led a great and inspirational life," Trump posted on his social media platform Truth Social. Ivana married Trump in 1977. They divorced 15 years later in 1992.

186.title: Delhi Traffic Police gets 450 body cams, 700 bikes to catch those speeding
186.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police issued 450 body cameras and 700 bikes to its staff in charge of catching people who are speeding or not wearing seat belts and other such offences. The cameras are attached to the uniform, police said. The traffic police in the national capital has divided its personnel into teams to look into traffic regulation, enforcement and prosecution.

187.title: HC allows Pune woman relocating abroad to take daughter with her
187.article_body: Bombay HC has allowed a Pune-based woman, who is embroiled in a matrimonial dispute with her husband, to relocate to Poland along with her nine-year-old daughter. "I don't think that the court can refuse...job prospects to a mother...she cannot be deprived of this opportunity," the judge said. The father should be allowed to virtually contact the child daily, court said.

188.title: B'luru Police arrest 6 for stealing gold, silver worth ₹22.5 lakh
188.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested six people accused of robbing jewellery and recovered 400 grams of gold ornaments and 3.5 kg of silver ornaments, the combined value of which is over ₹22 lakh, police said. Police said they also seized a car used to carry out the crime as well as ₹64,000 in cash. A weapon was also found, reports said.

189.title: Driver dies by suicide in Gurugram after wife elopes with neighbour
189.article_body: A cab driver died by suicide in Gurugram three days after his wife allegedly eloped with a neighbour, according to reports. The deceased had also reportedly filed a complaint against his wife and her lover with IMT Manesar police station before taking the extreme step. The deceased worked in a private company and drove an Ola cab.

190.title: Woman forced to undergo abortion 14 times, kills self in Delhi
190.article_body: A 33-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after being compelled to undergo abortion 14 times in a span of eight years by her boyfriend, who was also her live-in partner, police said. The deceased wrote in her suicide note that her partner had refused to marry her. A case of abetment of suicide has been registered against the man.

191.title: India lose an ODI under Rohit's captaincy for 1st time in 2022, England level series
191.article_body: England defeated India by 100 runs in the second ODI at Lord's to level the three-match series 1-1. This is the first time in 2022 that India have lost an ODI match under the captaincy of Rohit Sharma. Bowling first, India bowled England out for 246 runs in 49 overs. India were bowled out for 146 in 38.5 overs.

192.title: INS 'Dunagiri' to be launched into Hooghly river on Friday: Govt
192.article_body: The Ministry of Defence has stated that INS Dunagiri, a Project 17A frigate, will be launched into the Hooghly river at Garden Reach Shipbuilders and Engineers on Friday. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will be the chief guest for the event. P17A ships are follow-on of the P17 Frigates, with improved stealth features, advanced weapons and sensors and platform management systems.

193.title: Officials in Odisha seize marijuana worth ₹8 lakh, arrest one
193.article_body: In Odisha's Berhampur town, a team of excise department officials seized marijuana worth ₹8 lakh and arrested one person in connection with the case, an official said. Intelligence and enforcement bureau wing officials from the department acted on a tip-off and intercepted a vehicle from which they recovered 160 kg of marijuana. The driver of the vehicle was arrested.

194.title: Jamal Khashoggi's fiancee calls Biden's Saudi trip 'heartbreaking'
194.article_body: Murdered Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi's fiancee Hatice Cengiz called US President Joe Biden's upcoming visit to Saudi Arabia "heartbreaking", saying Biden was backing down from his promise to defend human rights. Biden on Friday will meet Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who has denied any knowledge or involvement in Khashoggi's 2018 killing.

195.title: Guru Granth Sahib insulted at Punjab CM Mann's marriage ceremony: SGPC
195.article_body: The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) has claimed that the vehicle carrying holy book Guru Granth Sahib was stopped for inspection at Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's wedding ceremony. The committee called the act an "insult to the honour of the Guru". "It was even more hurtful that this incident took place at [CM's] residence," SGPC chief Harjinder Singh Dhami said.

196.title: 5 drug peddlers arrested in Bengaluru; 5 kg hashish oil seized
196.article_body: Five alleged drug peddlers, including two women, were arrested in Bengaluru and 5 kg hashish oil worth ₹4 crore and 6 kg marijuana was seized from them, Karnataka Police said. Calling it an inter-state racket, Joint Commissioner of Police Raman Gupta said the accused had connections with drug smugglers in Bengaluru, Kochi, Chennai, Hyderabad and Mumbai.

197.title: Piyush Goyal reappointed Leader of House in Rajya Sabha
197.article_body: Following his election to the Parliament for a third term, Union Minister of Commerce and Industry, Piyush Goyal has been reappointed as the Leader of the House in the Rajya Sabha. The BJP has communicated its choice to the Rajya Sabha Chairman, Venkaiah Naidu. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had appointed Goyal as the leader of the Rajya Sabha in 2021.

198.title: Tripura CM sends 100 boxes of pineapples to Bangladeshi PM
198.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Manik Saha on Thursday sent 100 boxes of pineapples to Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina as part of a goodwill gesture. The move is also aimed at promoting Tripura's best horticultural crop in Bangladesh, a senior state government official said. Earlier, PM Hasina had sent 600 kgs of mangoes to Saha.

199.title: Japan warns of fresh COVID-19 wave
199.article_body: Japan on Thursday warned of a fresh COVID-19 wave as the country records a surge in new cases. On Wednesday, Tokyo registered 16,878 fresh cases, the highest count since February this year. "The coronavirus is spreading... through all age groups," Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said, urging citizens to get the booster shots.

200.title: Italian PM Mario Draghi says he will resign despite winning confidence vote
200.article_body: Italy's PM Mario Draghi on Thursday said he'll resign amid a political crisis. Draghi survived a no-confidence vote in the Italian Senate, yet his government's future was thrown into question due to a boycott of the vote by the populist Five Star Movement, a key coalition ally. "The national unity coalition that backed this government no longer exists," he said.

201.title: Khloe & her ex-boyfriend Tristan expecting 2nd child via surrogate: Reports
201.article_body: American television personality Khloe Kardashian and her ex-boyfriend Tristan Thompson are reportedly expecting a child together via surrogate. In a statement to People, Khloe's reps confirmed she and Tristan are having another baby and said, "We can confirm True will have a sibling who was conceived in November...We'd like to ask for...privacy so that Khloe can focus on her family."

202.title: Marathi actress accused of extortion ends hunger strike in jail
202.article_body: Marathi actress Shraddha Mangle, one of the accused in IAS officer Radheshyam Mopalwar's extortion case, ended her hunger strike in Thane jail on Thursday. The judge who is conducting her trial had convinced her to end the strike. Earlier, her advocate said that she started the strike on June 15, 2022. Mangle has been in the Thane jail since 2018.

203.title: Pak army officer found shot dead, militant group claims responsibility
203.article_body: Balochistan Liberation Army (BLA) claimed that it had kidnapped and killed a senior Pakistani army officer and his friend. Bodies of the two men were found in the Balochistan province on Thursday. The officer and his friend were kidnapped while they were on their way to Quetta city from Ziarat, a hill station, on Tuesday, a security official said.

204.title: Southern African countries extend troop deployment in Mozambique
204.article_body: The Southern African Development Community on Thursday extended its troop deployment in Mozambique by another month to fight an insurgency linked to the Islamic State. The SADC countries sent troops to the region last year and its mandate was set to end this week. The extension was granted ahead of the mid-August SADC Summit to analyse the mission's progress.

205.title: New COVID-19 cases rise for 5th straight week: WHO
205.article_body: The World Health Organization on Thursday said number of new COVID-19 cases worldwide has risen for the fifth consecutive week. Last week, 5.7 million new infections were confirmed, marking a 6% increase, even as the number of deaths was close to last week's figure at 9,800. In the last fortnight, cases surged by 30% driven by the infectious Omicron variant.

206.title: Anti-govt protesters vacate govt buildings in Sri Lanka
206.article_body: Anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka vacated several government buildings, including the President's house and the Prime Minister's office, on Thursday. "We've shown what power of the people can do, but it doesn't mean we have to occupy these places," a protest leader said. However, the protesters said that they will continue to occupy the President's office and Galle Face.

207.title: 2 shark attacks reported on US beaches in 1 day, swimming suspended
207.article_body: At least two shark attacks on US beaches on Wednesday in New York state's Long Island, urging authorities to suspend swimming there. In one incident, a 41-year-old surfer was attacked on his leg, inflicting a four-inch wound, while in the other, a 49-year-old man was bitten on his wrist and buttocks. Neither attack was life-threatening.

208.title: I had nobody to celebrate Ishaqzaade success; mom had passed away: Arjun
208.article_body: Arjun Kapoor said he had nobody to celebrate Ishaqzaade's success. He added while his sister was graduating, his mother passed away and his father was in America with his sister. "[I was] being accepted by the industry and audience and had bonafide mainstream success with my first film but I had nobody to share it with at home," he said.

209.title: Bus carrying Amarnath Yatra pilgrims meets with accident, many injured
209.article_body: A bus carrying around 40 Amarnath Yatra pilgrims collided head-on with a tipper dumper in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Thursday. The driver had reportedly lost control of the bus on the national highway near Nussu Badragund. At least 20 passengers were injured, Times Now reported. However, PTI reported officials as saying that eight pilgrims were injured.

210.title: I have no clue about this: Sushmita's brother after Lalit Modi confirms he's dating her
210.article_body: After former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirmed he's dating Sushmita Sen, the actress' brother Rajeev Sen said, "I actually have no clue about this." "I'm pleasantly surprised. I will speak to my sister before I say anything...My sister is yet to confirm this from her end, so, I can't comment as of now," he told ETimes.

211.title: Google-backed mental health startup Wysa raises $20 million
211.article_body: Google-backed mental health startup, Wysa, has raised $20 million in its Series B funding round. The round, led by HealthQuad and British International Investment, saw participation from existing investors such as Google Assistant Investments, pi Ventures and others. The platform's services are available to UK's National Health Service (NHS) and the Ministry of Health in Singapore, among others.

212.title: UP policeman tries to kill woman he raped on pretext of marriage
212.article_body: A UP Police sub-inspector was arrested on Thursday for allegedly trying to kill a woman he raped repeatedly on the pretext of marriage, officials said. According to the complainant, the accused introduced himself as Rinku Shukla to her and raped her repeatedly over the last two years. The accused forced her to get multiple abortions, reports said.

213.title: Impostor poses as Chennai mayor to cheat officials; attempt fails
213.article_body: Chennai mayor R Priya has filed a complaint with the police that an impostor tried to cheat Greater Chennai Corporation officials by posing as her on WhatsApp. The accused applied a picture of Priya as the display photo and told the officials to log onto an online gift card website. Zonal officials alerted Priya, following which the complaint was filed.

214.title: Byju's-owned Great Learning falsely advertises IIT-B course, may face legal action
214.article_body: Byju's-owned Great Learning is currently under fire for falsely advertising a Continuing Education and Quality Improvement Programme (CE&QIP) from IIT-Bombay as a Post Graduate Programme. The course alumni are looking to take legal action against the firm. While IIT-Bombay's website described the course as a part of the CE&QIP, Great Learning pamphlets advertised it as a PGP.

215.title: Arunachal Pradesh BJP MLA booked for rape
215.article_body: The police said that they have registered a case against a BJP MLA in Arunachal Pradesh for allegedly raping a woman at his residence in Itanagar. The case was registered at a women police station on Tuesday, the police said. It's condemnable if the alleged crime by the lawmaker is proved true, Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women stated.

216.title: TN class 12 girl dies by suicide after alleging torture from teachers
216.article_body: A class 12 student at a private school in Chinna Salem, Tamil Nadu has died by suicide, alleging torture by two of her teachers. The girl's body was found in the school's hostel building on Wednesday. While the teachers have denied the allegations, the girl's relatives protested on the Kallakurichi-Salem Highway and demanded justice.

217.title: Monsoon Session of Himachal Pradesh Assembly to begin on Aug 10
217.article_body: The Monsoon Session of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly will commence from August 10, an official spokesperson said. The decision was taken by Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur in a Cabinet meeting. The Cabinet recommended to the Governor that the session be held in four sittings from August 10-13 and also decided to fill 500 medical officer posts in Health Department.

218.title: ICC bans Bangladesh pacer Shohidul Islam for 10 months for doping violation
218.article_body: Bangladesh pacer Shohidul Islam has been banned for 10 months by ICC for doping violation. The 10-month suspension has been backdated to May 28, the day he admitted to the offence, meaning he'll be eligible to play from March 28, 2023. Shohidul's urine sample came positive for Clomifene, which is classified as a Specified Substance under WADA's Prohibited List.

219.title: Chhattisgarh govt increases additional excise duty on liquor
219.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government on Thursday increased the additional excise duty on alcoholic beverages in the state. Previously, the additional excise duty was ₹5 per bottle, which will now be ₹10, officials said. The move has been made to meet the excise revenue target of 2022-23 and for other development activities in the state, said State Minister Mohammad Akbar.

220.title: Car rams into autorickshaw on Sohna-Gurgaon road, 3 injured
220.article_body: A car allegedly crashed into an autorickshaw at a flyover on the Sohna-Gurgaon road and injured three people, the police said. The police further added that they were informed about the collision from the emergency response system. One of the injured, Palak, in her complaint said that after the accident the car driver abandoned his vehicle and fled.

221.title: 3 arrested over alleged involvement in 1984 anti-Sikh riots in Kanpur
221.article_body: A Special Investigation Team probing the 1984 anti-Sikh riots arrested three people, all aged above 60, on Thursday. They were allegedly part of a mob that had torched houses, killing several people in Kanpur. They've been booked under several sections of the IPC including Section 302 (murder). The SIT has so far arrested 22 people in connection with the riots.

222.title: Affordable healthcare shared responsibility of public & pvt sector: Vice Prez
222.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu said that providing quality and affordable healthcare is the shared responsibility of the private and public sector. Speaking at the Thalassemia and Sickle Cell Society in Hyderabad, he emphasised the need for preventive measures to address the burden of genetic diseases. Lack of awareness of genetic diseases, he said, is a reason they aren't diagnosed early.

223.title: 45 nations pledge to coordinate probes into alleged war crimes in Ukraine
223.article_body: Forty-five countries, including the US, the UK, Canada, Mexico and Australia, on Thursday agreed to coordinate investigations into suspected war crimes in Ukraine. Notably, Russia has repeatedly said that it is not involved in war crimes in Ukraine and also denied deliberately targeting civilians. Currently, there are about 23,000 alleged war crimes being probed in Ukraine.

224.title: No Pakistan connection in suspected terror module in Bihar: Police
224.article_body: After busting a potential terror module in Bihar, police on Thursday said no connection was established between Pakistan or Pakistan-based organisations and the arrested persons. "There's no involvement of any mainstream religious institution. They worked individually, away from the public eye," SSP Manavjit Singh said. Three persons were arrested in a suspected terror module in Patna on Thursday.

225.title: Rishi Sunak tops 2nd round of voting in contest to elect UK's next PM
225.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak won the most votes in the second round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as the leader of the Conservative Party and the Prime Minister of the country. Sunak received 101 votes, followed by Penny Mordaunt with 83 votes and Liz Truss with 64 votes. Notably, Indian-origin Suella Braverman was eliminated from the contest.

226.title: Murmu will get more votes than expected in Prez polls: Goa CM
226.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will get more votes than expected as BJP has 'numbers' in the state. "Apart from 25 MLAs, we have appealed to other MLAs too to vote for her," Sawant said. Murmu on Thursday arrived in Goa and sought support from MPs and MLAs for the upcoming Presidential elections.

227.title: Odisha BJP MLAs protest against Cong leader's remarks on Murmu
227.article_body: Odisha BJP MLAs held a protest inside the state Legislative Assembly on Thursday against Congress leader Ajoy Kumar's remarks on NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. The BJP also took out a protest rally in Bhubaneswar condemning Ajoy Kumar's statement. Congress leader Ajoy Kumar on Wednesday alleged that Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India".

228.title: 2 inter-state drug smugglers held in Jammu, 600 kg poppy straw seized
228.article_body: Two alleged inter-state drug smugglers were arrested in Jammu's Sidhra on Thursday and 600 kg of poppy straw was seized from their truck, an officer of the Anti-Narcotic Task Force said. The truck was on its way to Punjab from Kashmir when it was intercepted, the official said. Twenty-four plastic bags containing poppy straw concealed under plywood sheets were recovered.

229.title: Aamir organises special screening of 'Laal...' for Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna
229.article_body: Aamir Khan, who'll be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', hosted a special screening of the film for a few Telugu celebrities including Chiranjeevi, Nagarjuna, SS Rajamouli, Sukumar and Naga Chaitanya. A picture of Aamir watching 'Laal Singh Chaddha' with Telugu film personalities was shared on social media. It is the Hindi remake of Tom Hanks-starrer 'Forrest Gump'.

230.title: Charge-sheet filed against 37 accused in Delhi's Jahangirpuri violence
230.article_body: The Delhi Police on Thursday filed a charge-sheet against 37 people in the communal clashes that broke out in Jahangirpuri on Hanuman Jayanti in April. The Crime Branch filed a 2,063-page charge-sheet at Rohini Court, which stated that eight accused are still on the run and the others were booked under charges of rioting, arson, attempted murder and criminal conspiracy.

231.title: Lalit Modi's 9-year-old 'Reply my SMS' tweet to Sushmita Sen goes viral
231.article_body: After former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirmed that he is dating Sushmita Sen, his nine-year-old 'Reply my SMS' tweet to the actress has gone viral. "So this is where it all started," a Twitter user wrote. "God works in mysterious ways," another user commented on the viral tweet. Another user wrote, "Taking notes right now."

232.title: This 60-65 kg boy lifted 100 kg, he did it on his own: Sukhwinder on Ranbir
232.article_body: Sukhwinder Singh who's a part of 'Shamshera' praised Ranbir Kapoor in an interview. He said, "When I went on...sets [of Shamshera], there was a fight sequence and I saw that Ranbir...sahab, this boy, was doing everything on his own with his...physical effort." "This 60-65 kg boy was lifting 100 kg guys and there were no special effects," he added.

233.title: Viral pic shows crab with human-like teeth in Russia
233.article_body: A photograph of a crab, that appears to have 'human-like teeth', has gone viral. The picture has been shared by Roman Fedortsov, who works on a fishing vessel in Western Russia, on Instagram. "That's human teeth. Tell me I'm wrong," a comment read while another person commented, "Looks like a Pokémon in the final stage of being beaten in battle."

234.title: IT Department raids Cong MLA Sanjay Sharma's bungalow, sugar mill
234.article_body: The Income Tax Department is conducting search operations at premises linked to Sanjay Sharma, a Congress MLA from Tendukheda. The MLA is reportedly a liquor and sand baron in Madhya Pradesh. The search action covered 44 premises including Sharma's bungalow in Jabalpur and a sugar mill in Narsinghpur. As per reports, documents related to income tax evasion have been seized.

235.title: Being below poverty line no exception for not abiding by rule of law: SC
235.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday said that being below the poverty line is "not an exception" to not abide by the rule of law which has to be adhered to by all concerned. "When the Constitution recognises rule of law, it has to be adhered to by one and all," said a bench of Justices AM Khanwilakar and JB Pardiwala.

236.title: BJP running 'Operation Kamal' in Prez polls, bribing people: Sinha
236.article_body: Ahead of Presidential elections, opposition parties’ Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has accused the BJP of carrying out 'Operation Kamal' by engaging in horse-trading. Sinha, who has sought a probe into the matter, alleged that the party is offering a "huge sum of money to non-BJP MLAs" to back NDA's candidate in polls. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.

237.title: German regulator warns electricity bills could triple
237.article_body: Germany's energy regulator has said electricity bills are expected to triple in the coming year as there were reductions on gas imports from Russia due to its invasion of Ukraine. Chief of Federal Network Agency Klaus Müller said the market price for electricity had increased sevenfold in some cases. He said households must make financial preparations for the future.

238.title: AI startup Detect Technologies raises $28 mn in Series B round
238.article_body: Artificial Intelligence-based software-as-a-service (Saas) firm Detect Technologies has raised $28 million in its Series B funding round. Led by Prosus Ventures, the round saw participation from existing investors Accel, Elevation Capital, Shell Ventures, among others. The startup provides industries with cloud-based applications to enhance visibility of industrial risks and improve productivity.

239.title: Fire breaks out at hotel in Delhi's Paharganj, 10 rescued
239.article_body: A fire broke out at a hotel in Delhi's Paharganj area, on Thursday morning, officials said. Ten people were rescued from the fire that broke out on the second floor of the Roma Delux hotel in Paharganj, and no casualties were reported. The owner of the hotel, Ritik Kapoor, said that the fire was triggered due to a short circuit.

240.title: My dad & brother were confident about me doing Gupt with Rajiv Rai: Bobby
240.article_body: As film 'Gupt' clocked 25 years, actor Bobby Deol said his father Dharmendra and brother Sunny Deol were confident of him working with Rajiv Rai. "My brother had already worked with Rajiv and my father had already worked with Rajiv's dad in earlier films," he added. "They knew...their son and their brother was in safe hands," Bobby said.

241.title: Nepal Parliament's lower house passes 1st Citizenship Amendment Bill
241.article_body: The lower house of Nepal's Parliament on Wednesday passed the country's first Citizenship Amendment Bill. The bill has been introduced to make Nepal's citizenship process more inclusive, according to Home Minister Bal Krishna Khand. Notably, the bill was under discussion for more than two years due to a lack of political consensus over it.

242.title: Russian missile strikes on Ukrainian city kill 21 people: Officials
242.article_body: Russian missile strikes on the Ukrainian city of Vinnytsia on Thursday have killed at least 21 people, including three children, according to officials. The missile strikes were launched from a Russian submarine in the Black Sea, Ukraine claimed. "What is this, if not an open act of terrorism?" Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

243.title: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirms he is dating Sushmita Sen, shares pics
243.article_body: Ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi has revealed he's dating actress Sushmita Sen. Sharing pictures, he tweeted, "Just back in London after a whirling global tour...with the families...not to mention my better half Sushmita Sen...a new beginning a new life finally. Over the moon." He further tweeted, "Just for clarity. Not married...just dating each other. That too...will happen one day."

244.title: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa resigns after arriving in Singapore
244.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has resigned after landing in Singapore. "The Speaker of Sri Lanka's Parliament has received President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation letter," Sri Lankan Speaker's office said. The Singapore government has said Rajapaksa is on a "private visit" and has not asked for asylum and neither has he been granted any asylum.

245.title: 'I2U2' nations want to combine resources to propel growth: Israel PM
245.article_body: Speaking at the first I2U2 (India-Israel-UAE-US) summit, Israeli PM Yair Lapid said that the member countries share a common vision wherein they want to combine resources to propel growth. "It's clear that all want the same thing including infrastructure development, quality education... and [environmental conservation]," Lapid said. "We want to change the world for the better," he added.

246.title: Bengal CM Mamata prepares momos at Darjeeling stall; video surfaces
246.article_body: A video that has surfaced on social media shows West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee preparing momos at a roadside shop in Darjeeling. The video shows Banerjee flattening the dough and stuffing it. "Darjeeling will always have my heart and I salute the hard-working people of our hills who make every visit so memorable," she wrote on Facebook.

247.title: UAE to invest $2 bn to develop integrated food parks across India
247.article_body: The United Arab Emirates will invest $2 billion to develop a series of integrated food parks across India, according to the joint statement issued by four-nation grouping I2U2 (India, Israel, the UAE and the US). This is a part of I2U2's efforts to tackle the food insecurity in South Asia and Middle East. India will provide land for the project.

248.title: Lata Mangeshkar's family to set up old-age home for artists in Nashik
248.article_body: Late singer Lata Mangeshkar's family will set up an old-age home for artists in Nashik. The singer had registered the foundation herself in July 2021. "It was Lata Didi's vision to help and heal elderly artists who are either abandoned by their children or feel financially helpless to sustain their lives," the family said in the statement.

249.title: India's first monkeypox case reported in Kerala
249.article_body: India on Thursday confirmed its first monkeypox case in Kerala. The person is a traveller from UAE and reached the state on July 12. "He reached Trivandrum airport and all the steps are being taken as per the guidelines issued by WHO and ICMR," said Kerala Health Minister Veena George.

250.title: What a waste of time, energy & money: Mahindra on fallout of Elon Musk-Twitter deal
250.article_body: Anand Mahindra has commented on the fallout of the $44-billion deal between Elon Musk and Twitter. "What a waste of time, energy & money," he wrote. He added, "Twitter's an indispensable source of news and connectedness. Can it be run like a quasi social enterprise...listed, for profit...but with...strong charter & managed by...board with directors who act responsibly like trustees?"

251.title: Inadequate police cover led to Shinzo Abe's death: Japan PM
251.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Thursday said inadequate police cover led to the death of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. "I urge them (police) to fix what needs to be fixed, while also studying examples in other countries," Kishida said. Abe, who was Japan's longest serving Prime Minister, was assassinated in western Japan last Friday.

252.title: I worked as spot boy at 17 after my father fell sick: Anil Kapoor
252.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor, who recently completed 39 years as an actor in Bollywood, has recalled the beginning of his career when he used to work as a spot boy at the age of 17. "We came to know he (father) has heart issues," he added. "I...loved waking up...actors...fetching them from the airport [and] dropping them to the location," he said.

253.title: UP govt bans sale of liquor, meat on routes used for Kanwar Yatra
253.article_body: The UP government has banned the sale of liquor and meat on routes being used for Kanwar Yatra and enhanced security arrangements along the routes for the safety of Kanwariyas. Additionally, no transportation of meat or animal carcasses will be allowed on those routes. Notably, neighbouring Uttarakhand has barred Kanwariyas from carrying swords, tridents and other harmful objects.

254.title: ISIS claims responsibility for fatal attack on J&K ASI, releases video
254.article_body: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday which left Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Mushtaq Ahmad dead. Amaq, the propaganda group of ISIS, has released a 40-second purported body camera footage where an attacker is seen carrying a pistol and opening fire at policemen while raising slogans such as "Allah-o-Akbar" and "Lailaha-illallah".

255.title: Principals of two Bengaluru schools suspended
255.article_body: The principals of Bishop Cotton Boys' School and St John's High School in Bengaluru have been suspended over allegations of not following due processes, the Karnataka Central Diocese has said without elaborating on the accusations. The Diocese has formed a three-member committee to probe the allegations and will issue a statement thereafter. Both schools are over 160 years old.

256.title: After expelling O Panneerselvam, AIADMK sacks his sons & 16 supporters
256.article_body: AIADMK interim chief Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Thursday expelled O Panneerselvam's sons and 16 other supporters of the ousted leader from the party. This comes days after the AIADMK expelled Panneerselvam. AIADMK on Monday elected Palaniswami as its Interim General Secretary and vested in him full powers to head the organisation.

257.title: Rescue operations almost ended: J&K LG on Amarnath cloudburst
257.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha said the rescue operations after the cloudburst near the Amarnath cave have "almost ended". Every pilgrim is insured with ₹5 lakh and the shrine board has decided to provide additional ₹5 lakh to the families of the deceased, Sinha said. At least 16 people were killed after a cloudburst near Amarnath cave last week.

258.title: Class 12 school student arrested for stabbing classmates in Delhi
258.article_body: A class 12 student was arrested for allegedly stabbing his classmates following a quarrel at a government school in Delhi's Bhati Mines area, police said on Thursday. Mohit (accused) attacked Ankush (victim) with a knife when an argument broke out between the two, DCP (south) Benita Mary Jaiker said. Mohit attacked two other classmates when they intervened, she added.

259.title: Chhattisgarh man kills girlfriend with hammer suspecting infidelity
259.article_body: A 28-year-old man died by suicide after allegedly killing his girlfriend with a hammer and a blade over suspicion of infidelity in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, police said on Wednesday. The accused attacked his girlfriend with a hammer and blade at her rented house, before taking the extreme step, ASP (west) Akash Rao Giripunje said.

260.title: Aamir to appear as special guest on Big B's Kaun Banega Crorepati 14: Reports
260.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan will reportedly be joining Amitabh Bachchan for the first episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati 14. According to reports, the first episode will see a few real-life heroes, from sports stars to army officers and policemen. Reports added that Aamir Khan will also be seen talking about his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in the episode.

261.title: 90% work of Mopa airport complete, commissioning after Aug 15: Goa CM
261.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that about 90% work of the Mopa International Airport in the state has been completed. The airport in North Goa district would be commissioned between August 15 and September 1 this year, Sawant said. A skill development centre has started operating at the site where students are being trained for employment, he added.

262.title: Five killed as car rams into a tree in Haryana's Narnaul
262.article_body: Police on Thursday said that five people were killed after the car in which they were travelling rammed into a tree near the Raghunathpura bypass in Haryana's Narnaul. "The car hit a tree along the road," Narnaul city police station SHO Santosh Kumar said. The deceased were in the mid-30 to mid-50 age group, Kumar added.

263.title: Land allotted to build equivalent of IIT in Pak turns into 'bakra mandi'
263.article_body: Dr Umar Saif, ex-Vice-Chancellor of Pakistan's Information Technology University, revealed that the land allotted for the construction of an equivalent of IIT in Pakistan has turned into a 'bakra mandi'. He tweeted that the land was kept aside for the construction of the institute in 2013. He shared pictures from the site, showing how the area has turned into marketplace.

264.title: Sri Lanka President allowed entry on private visit, hasn't been granted asylum: Singapore
264.article_body: Singapore government has confirmed that Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has been allowed entry on a "private visit". "He has not asked for asylum and neither has he been granted any asylum. Singapore generally does not grant requests for asylum," said Singapore government. Sri Lanka Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe was named acting President after Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka.

265.title: MCD issues notices to 40,000 Delhi residents over property tax
265.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has issued notices to around 40,000 residents whose property tax records of any financial year or payment receipts are not available with the MCD, officials said on Wednesday. Notably, some of the residents have been asked to furnish tax receipts dating as far back as 2004. AAP has called for the notices to be withdrawn.

266.title: Drug peddler arrested with marijuana worth ₹4.7 lakh in Pune
266.article_body: Pune Police on Wednesday arrested a drug peddler who was caught with 23.6 kg of marijuana worth ₹4.7 lakh. The accused, identified as Suraj Kantilal Bora, was nabbed at Lonikand after the anti-narcotics cell of the Pune Police received a tip-off on his whereabouts. Bora has been booked under sections of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

267.title: Rupee drops 9 paise to close at all-time low of 79.90 against US dollar
267.article_body: The rupee declined by 9 paise to close at a new record low of 79.90 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 79.72 and witnessed intra-day high of 79.71 and a low of 79.92 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, brent crude futures, the global oil benchmark, dropped 2.20% to $97.38/barrel.

268.title: Ruraltech startup FAARMS raises $10 mn in a funding round
268.article_body: Ruraltech startup FAARMS has raised $10 million in a recent funding round. The round was led by Dr Cornelius Boersch, Founder of Conny & Co., Singaporean angel investor Koh Boon Hwee, and saw participation from Apoorva Ranjan Sharma, Co-founder of Venture Catalysts and 9 Unicorns, among others. The Bengaluru-based startup was founded by Taranbir Singh and Alok Duggal in 2020.

269.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires recruitment company WOLVES
269.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's subsidiary, upGrad Rekrut, has acquired Bengaluru-based recruitment and staffing firm WOLVES, for an undisclosed amount. Founded in 2014, WOLVES India places tech talent across startups, along with mid-size and large organisations and has closed over 5,000 placements till date. WOLVES India will operate independently as a subsidiary of upGrad Rekrut, as per a statement.

270.title: Twitter down for thousands of users across the globe
270.article_body: Twitter is down for thousands of users across the globe, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. The issues started with the service at around 5:40 pm IST, with a lot of users reporting 'over capacity' error messages. It is the first major Twitter outage since February, as per The Verge.

271.title: Will is apologetic: Kevin on Will Smith-Chris Rock slap controversy at Oscars
271.article_body: Actor Will Smith's friend Kevin Hart opened up about how Will is doing after the slap controversy. He said that Will is "apologetic and he's in a "better space". "I can...hope that the two of them find a way to find some solace in that and move past it," he added. "Ultimately, life goes on and people grow," Kevin said.

272.title: Centre upgrades security of Kumar Vishwas to Y+ category
272.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has upgraded the security of former Aam Aadmi Party leader Kumar Vishwas from Y to Y+ category, ANI reported. The decision is based on a threat assessment report by Intelligence Bureau. In February, the Centre had granted Y security cover to Vishwas after he accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of having links with separatist outfits.

273.title: ₹229 crore allotted to restore 26 lakes in Bengaluru
273.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will spend ₹229 crore to restore 26 lakes in Bengaluru, as concretisation threatens its water resources. While the detailed project reports (DPRs) for 10 lakes have been prepared, the civic body is calling for public suggestions to complete the remaining DPRs. Citizens have demanded the DPRs be prepared online to maintain transparency.

274.title: Bhutan to reopen for foreign tourists from Sept, will triple entry fees
274.article_body: Bhutan will reopen its borders to foreign tourists for first time since pandemic broke out in 2020 from September 23 onwards. Bhutan will hike its sustainable development fees, which is mandatory to enter country, from $65 (over ₹5,000) per night, per person to $200 (over ₹15,000). "COVID-19 has allowed us to...rethink how [tourism] sector can be best...operated," Foreign Minister said.

275.title: Removing gangster culture, curbing drug menace priority: Punjab DGP
275.article_body: Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav on Thursday said eliminating gangster culture and controlling the drug menace are the top priorities of the state police. The state police is committed to maintaining law and order, he said, asserting that the Punjab Police is one of the best police forces in the world. We will ensure people-friendly police, he added.

276.title: Don't want to be on another platform: Ranbir on staying away from social media
276.article_body: When asked why he is not there on social media, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "I don’t want to be on another platform and put in hard work and show my personality there." "I am a film actor and would love to remain so," he added. On the professional front, Ranbir will be next seen in the film 'Shamshera'.

277.title: No word has been banned, clarifies Lok Sabha Speaker on 'unparliamentary' words
277.article_body: Amid criticism over a list of words deemed unfit for Parliament that included terms like 'corrupt' and 'incompetent', Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said no word had been "banned". "We've issued a compilation of...words that have been expunged," Birla added. "Earlier a book of...unparliamentary words used to be released...To avoid wastage of papers, we've put it on internet," he stated.

278.title: CAQM frames new policy to fight air pollution in Delhi-NCR
278.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) on Wednesday unveiled a new policy to curb air pollution in Delhi and National Capital Region (NCR). The policy lists sector-wise action plans to reduce air pollution in the next five years. One of the measures the policy suggests is the phasing out of diesel-run auto-rickshaws in NCR by December 31, 2026.

279.title: SIT gets 4 more days to interrogate 4 Moosewala killing suspects
279.article_body: Punjab Police's Special Investigation Team (SIT) has received four more days to interrogate four suspects, including two shooters, over the murder of Sidhu Moosewala. This comes as a Mansa court on Wednesday extended the police remand for these suspects till Sunday. The SIT had said that their further custodial interrogation is required to recover the weapons used in the crime.

280.title: Did films where my heart wasn't there, won't do them again: Rajkummar
280.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he did one or two films, where his heart wasn't there and he'll not be doing that anymore. "I want to go back home after a day's work and think 'you know, I did something good today'," he added. "I want to feel content doing that job. So I'm gonna...be in that process forever," he said.

281.title: IRCTC offers 6-day tour package to Nepal from Aug 8, starting at ₹38,400
281.article_body: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has announced a six-day and five-night air package for Nepal, starting at ₹38,400 per person. The tourists will get to cover Pashupatinath Temple, Patan and Durbar Square, among other locations, during the journey, which will commence on August 8. The flight will depart at 7:45 am from Madhya Pradesh’s Bhopal airport.

282.title: Daler Mehndi arrested after court upholds 2-year sentence in human trafficking case
282.article_body: Singer Daler Mehndi has been arrested and sent to jail after a Patiala court on Thursday dismissed the appeal filed by him against his two-year jail sentence in a human trafficking case registered against him in 2003. Daler and his brother were sentenced to two years in jail in 2018, following which they were granted bail.

283.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against England, Virat Kohli returns
283.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the second ODI at Lord's. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Virat Kohli replacing Shreyas Iyer. Kohli had missed the first ODI due to a groin strain. England are fielding an unchanged playing XI.

284.title: Pakistan will be more challenging than Australia: SL captain Karunaratne
284.article_body: Sri Lanka's Test captain Dimuth Karunaratne said it will be "more challenging" for his team to face Pakistan in their upcoming two-match Test series, in comparison to the recently concluded Test series against Australia which ended 1-1. "Pakistan's...a brilliant team...They play spin well," added Karunaratne. "Playing at the same venue three times is a big advantage for us," he stated.

285.title: Over 5 crore pilgrims expected in U'khand during Kanwar Yatra: CM Dhami
285.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Thursday said that the state is expecting a footfall of more than five crore pilgrims during the Kanwar Yatra this year. "We have made all the arrangements regarding the smooth conduct and safety during the Kanwar Yatra," he said. "We appeal to them to follow the rules made by the administration," Dhami added.

286.title: Wall collapses on labourers amid heavy rains in Gujarat, 3 killed
286.article_body: Two women labourers and a 16-year-old girl were killed after a boundary wall near an under-construction site collapsed on them amid heavy rainfall in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Thursday. A total of five workers were injured in the incident. Ahmedabad recorded an average rainfall of 27 mm in the morning hours.

287.title: Not Chinese people, some Chinese hardliners consider me separatist: Dalai Lama
287.article_body: The Dalai Lama on Thursday said not Chinese people but some Chinese "hardliners" consider him a separatist. "Now, more and more Chinese are realising that Dalai Lama is not seeking independence but within China meaningful autonomy and to preserve Tibetan Buddhist culture," he said in Jammu. He will make his first trip to Leh in about four years on Friday.

288.title: All clearances given for Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
288.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has given all clearances for expediting the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train project, said state Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis. The pending approvals were related to issues like forest clearances and land acquisition among others, he added. The total estimated cost of the bullet train project is ₹1,10,000 crore.

289.title: Delhi court asks for CCTV footage after Sharjeel Imam claims assault in jail
289.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday asked for CCTV footage of a Tihar Jail cell after activist Sharjeel Imam claimed that he was assaulted inside his cell. Imam, who is in judicial custody in connection with the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case, had alleged that he was called "terrorist" and "anti-national" by the assistant superintendent of Tihar Jail and eight-nine convicts.

290.title: 9 bikes charred after fire breaks out in Pune residential building
290.article_body: As many as nine motorcycles were charred after a fire broke out in a residential building in Pune's Chandan Nagar on Thursday. The fire, which broke out in the building's parking lot, was controlled before it could spread to the houses, police said, adding that no one was injured. The fire was caused by a short circuit, preliminary probe found.

291.title: Over 52,000 Kashmiris dependent on drugs, of them 95% use heroin: Survey
291.article_body: At least 2.8% of Kashmir's total population has been substance users, with 52,404 dependent on drugs currently, according to a latest survey conducted by the Jammu and Kashmir government. As per the report, out of the total drug dependents, approximately 95% are heroin users. The average age of initiation of heroin in Kashmiris is 22, the survey found.

292.title: 1 dead, over 80 injured amid ongoing anti-govt protests in Colombo
292.article_body: At least one person has died and over 80 others were left injured on Wednesday amid ongoing anti-government protests in Sri Lanka's Colombo, reports stated. The deceased, a 26-year-old man, reportedly died after developing breathing difficulties when forces opened tear gas to quell protesters. A curfew has been imposed in Colombo till 5 am on July 15 to prevent unrest.

293.title: Shah Jahan didn't invite quotations for Taj: Goa Minister on not floating tender for work
293.article_body: Goa Minister for Art and Culture Govind Gaude cited the example of Taj Mahal to defend the government's decision to not seek tenders for the renovation work of Kala Academy. He said, "How is Taj Mahal beautiful and everlasting even today? Because Shah Jahan never invited any quotations. Now it's almost 390 years and Taj Mahal stands as it is."

294.title: No contempt proceedings against ex-HC judge, others for criticising SC's remarks on Nupur
294.article_body: Attorney General KK Venugopal has said there can be no contempt-of-court proceedings against a former Delhi HC judge and two lawyers who had criticised Supreme Court's observations on Nupur Sharma for her remark against Prophet Muhammad. "Fair and reasonable criticism of judicial proceedings would not constitute contempt of court," he said. The comments by them were not abusive, Venugopal stated.

295.title: 5 arrested for helping Moosewala killing suspect get fake passport
295.article_body: Police have said that a Delhi-based gang helped Sachin Thapan Bishnoi in procuring a forged passport. Sachin, nephew of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, is allegedly one of the key conspirators in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case. Five people, including a 27-year-old woman, have been arrested for helping Sachin procure the passport. Police suspect they also helped Anmol Bishnoi get a passport.

296.title: New dictionary for new India: Rahul on 'unparliamentary' words list
296.article_body: Congress’ Rahul Gandhi reacted to list of words that are banned in Parliament. "New dictionary for new India," Rahul tweeted. "Unparliamentary: Words used in discussions and debates which correctly describe PM’s handling of government, now banned from being spoken," the image Gandhi tweeted, read. "Example...'Jumlajeevi tanashah shed crocodile tears when his lies...were exposed'," he added.

297.title: MCD launches QR code-based plastic waste collection service in Karol Bagh
297.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) Karol Bagh zone, in collaboration with an NGO, has launched a QR code-based initiative for the collection of plastic waste. The civic body will try to implement this facility in other zones under the corporation, an official said. Through this initiative, plastic will be prevented from reaching landfill sites, the official added.

298.title: 2 killed after Greek firefighting helicopter crashes into sea
298.article_body: Two people were killed after a helicopter fighting a forest fire on the Greek island of Samos crashed into the sea on Wednesday, the Greek coast guard said. Two others on board the helicopter have been rescued, it added. The accident reportedly occurred when the helicopter was resupplying sea water to fight a fire that broke out near Paleochori village.

299.title: How can 15 students decide?: Delhi HC junks plea to postpone NEET-UG
299.article_body: Delhi High Court on Thursday dismissed a plea seeking postponement of the NEET-UG exam scheduled for July 17, saying there is no merit in the petition. "How can 15 students decide whether the exam should be postponed or not? You were aware of these things in April," the court said. It added that these types of petitions should be discouraged.

300.title: Noida Police arrests 14 Chinese nationals for illegally staying in India
300.article_body: As many as 14 Chinese nationals were detained from Noida's Sector 49 Police Station limits for allegedly staying in India illegally since 2020. They all worked for a private company in Noida and possessed valid passports but their business visas had expired, police said. Last month, a Chinese national was arrested for not having a valid passport or visa.

301.title: Harbhajan said play smartly, got out himself: Kaif on 2002 NatWest final
301.article_body: Discussing the 2002 NatWest Final between India and England where he scored an unbeaten 87, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said Harbhajan Singh asked him to play smartly but got bowled himself. India chased down a target of 326 following a partnership of 120 runs between Yuvraj Singh and Kaif. Harbhajan stated that the win changed the face of Indian cricket.

302.title: Ola Electric invests $100 mn in battery cell research: Report
302.article_body: Ola Electric, the electric vehicle arm of Ola, has invested $100 million in lithium-ion battery cell research and development, according to reports from brokerages ICICI Securities and Edelweiss. CEO Bhavish Aggarwal unveiled the first indigenously developed lithium-ion battery cell. Ola will begin the mass production of the cell by 2023 and aims to develop the in-house capability by 2026.

303.title: BMC collects ₹2.85 lakh fine from plastic ban violators in 2 weeks
303.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has seized 225 kg of plastic and collected a fine of ₹2.85 lakh under a drive that began on July 1. "A ward-wise team of officials has inspected 6,600 places and taken action against 55 violators using banned plastic," an official said. The state legislature passed a law prohibiting the use of plastic in 2018.

304.title: Mumbai man held for trying to extort ₹25,000 per month from spa manager
304.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Sudai Yadav alias Sudhir Master, was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹25,000 per month from the manager of a spa in south Mumbai for allowing the establishment to operate, police said. The accused has five offences, including rape and extortion, registered against him, an official said. A complaint has been lodged under IPC section 384 (extortion).

305.title: H'yana vigilance dept nabbed 91 officials in last 6 months for taking bribe
305.article_body: The Haryana State Vigilance Bureau has arrested 91 government officials from January to June 30 this year for accepting bribes. The officers were arrested for taking bribes ranging from ₹5,000 to ₹5 lakh in separate cases. "On average, 15 public servants were arrested on corruption charges every month," a spokesperson of the State Vigilance Bureau said on Thursday.

306.title: IMF reaches staff-level deal with Pak to disburse $1.17 bn in funds
306.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Thursday announced it had reached a staff-level agreement with Pakistan that would pave the way for disbursement of $1.17 billion. The latest tranche is part of a $6-billion loan programme of the IMF. "The Agreement with the Fund has set the stage to bring country out of economic difficulties," PM Shehbaz Sharif said.

307.title: CSK's Robin Uthappa blessed with a baby girl, shares family pic
307.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) batter Robin Uthappa and his wife Shheethal have been blessed with their second child, a baby girl. Sharing a family picture on Instagram, Uthappa wrote, "With hearts that are full we'd love to introduce our newest angel in our lives. Introducing Trinity Thea Uthappa." Robin and Shheethal got married in 2016.

308.title: GHMC along with Hyderabad Police bust synthetic fingerprint scam
308.article_body: The GHMC Enforcement Vigilance and Disaster Management wing along with Hyderabad Police busted a synthetic fingerprint scam. A probe was initiated after reports stated that some supervisors in sanitation division used fake fingerprints to indicate biometric attendance. "Several personnel were not physically present...but their attendance was being recorded on a regular basis," an official said.

309.title: Woman forced to drink acid for giving birth to girl child in Assam; dead
309.article_body: A woman in Assam's Karimganj died after her husband and in-laws allegedly forced her to consume acid for giving birth to a girl child. According to police, family members of the deceased have alleged that she was being tortured physically and mentally by her husband and in-laws for the last few days. Police have arrested her husband.

310.title: My govt committed to all-round development of Maha: CM Shinde
310.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said he was a "sevak" and his government was committed to the all-round development of the state and the welfare of its citizens. Shinde said that the decisions for the people should have been taken two and a half years back, but since that did not happen, 50 MLAs had to take a stand.

311.title: Two-wheeler offender apprehended in Hyderabad, 22 bikes seized
311.article_body: Hyderabad's Uppal Police apprehended a two-wheeler offender and recovered 22 bikes worth ₹13.5 lakh from him, Rachakonda Police tweeted. The accused has been identified as 19-year-old Raju, who used to work in Hyderabad's LB Nagar. The accused was stopped during a vehicle check and when questioned, he confessed to have committed 22 two-wheeler thefts, police said.

312.title: I wish I had done Allu Arjun's role in 'Pushpa': Ranbir Kapoor
312.article_body: In an interview, Ranbir Kapoor said he wishes he'd done Allu Arjun's role in 'Pushpa: The Rise', adding that Ramayana is one of his all-time favourite books. Arjun had earlier shared that it felt like he'd done four films together after working in 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Arjun has previously drawn praise from Shah Rukh Khan, having been termed "too wonderful".

313.title: I've lot more tolerance for bullshit now, I've calmed down a lot: Taapsee
313.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that she's a very different person from what she was in the beginning. "I've a lot more tolerance for bullshit now, to begin with. I've kind of like calmed down a lot from what I was before," she added. "I was way too over-impulsive [before]...Not my monkey, not my business. I've learned that attitude...little," Taapsee said.

314.title: Remains of 8,000 Nazi war victims found in mass grave in Poland
314.article_body: A mass grave containing 17.5 tonnes of human ashes, equivalent to at least 8,000 people, was unearthed near a former Nazi concentration camp in Poland, the country's national remembrance institute said. The bodies are thought to have been burned in a Nazi operation to hide evidence of their murders. The victims "were probably assassinated around 1939", investigator Tomasz Jankowski said.

315.title: US Judge rejects Amber Heard's request for new trial with Johnny Depp
315.article_body: Judge Penney Azcarate, the Virginia judge who oversaw Johnny Depp's defamation case against actress Amber Heard, has rejected actress Heard's request for a new trial. This comes after Heard's lawyers had alleged that the wrong juror sat during the trial. "Defendant does not allege Juror Fifteen's inclusion on the jury prejudiced her in any way," Azcarate wrote.

316.title: Ignoring Samson for Shreyas beyond cricketing rationale: Ex-cricketer Ganesh
316.article_body: Reacting to India's squad for West Indies T20Is, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh said the omission of Sanju Samson is "beyond rationale". He tweeted, "Ideally, you'd want players like Sanju Samson in the T20Is. Ignoring him for Shreyas Iyer is beyond cricketing rationale." Samson was part of India's squad for the first England T20I but wasn't included in playing XI.

317.title: Trader uses ₹36 cr fake invoices, evades ₹13 cr GST in Pune; held
317.article_body: Officials of the Maharashtra GST department have arrested a 26-year-old Pune-based trader for allegedly using fake invoices worth ₹36.34 crore and evading GST of ₹13.08 crore. Doulat Shivlal Choudhary will remain in judicial custody till July 27, 2022. The arrest was made after the GST department noticed suspicious business activity by Choudhary's Shiv Steel Traders amounting to over ₹72.68 crore.

318.title: Alt News Co-founder Zubair moves SC to quash 6 FIRs against him in UP
318.article_body: Alt News Co-founder and fact-checker Mohammed Zubair on Thursday approached the Supreme Court seeking to quash all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, a court in UP's Hathras on Thursday sent him to 14-day judicial custody. The UP government has formed a two-member Special Investigation Team to probe the six cases lodged against Zubair.

319.title: ED arrests former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, gets 4-day remand in money laundering case
319.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested former CEO and MD of National Stock Exchange (NSE) Chitra Ramkrishna in a money laundering case. The ED filed the case in connection with the illegal phone tapping case and the snooping case of employees of the stock exchange. In March, Chitra was arrested by CBI in connection with the NSE co-location case in Delhi.

320.title: You can't say it's Hooda vs Kohli, Hooda has played 3-4 matches: Piyush Chawla
320.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's criticism over his recent form, former India spinner Piyush Chawla has said the former India captain is someone who walks into Team India's playing XI "straightaway". Chawla added, "Deepak Hooda has just played three-four games at the international level...you can't say it's Kohli vs Hooda." Kohli has been rested for the white-ball tour of West Indies.

321.title: Context is important in what you speak in Parliament: Owaisi on list of words banned
321.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in the Parliament, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said context is important in what you speak in the Parliament. "You cannot just term words unparliamentary," he added. Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary which includes 'corrupt', 'jumlajeevi' and 'lie' among other words.

322.title: Arms including AK-47, cane bombs recovered from Maoist hideouts in Bihar
322.article_body: A huge cache of arms, including an AK-47 rifle, suspected to be hidden by Maoists was recovered from forest areas in Bihar's Gaya and Aurangabad districts on Wednesday. "It is suspected that [the] Maoist group...escaped before the troops reached the spot," said Gaya SSP Harpreet Kaur. Police also recovered 372 cane bombs and 394 live cartridges among other items.

323.title: Terror module busted in Bihar; 3 including retired J'khand police officer held
323.article_body: As many as three people, including a retired police officer of Jharkhand, were arrested in a suspected terror module, officials said on Thursday. "Because PM Narendra Modi was coming, we were alert...we came to know about these people's office and we started investigating it closely," police said. Notably, PM Modi visited Jharkhand's Deoghar and Bihar's Patna on July 12.

324.title: Several areas in Bengaluru to face power cuts on July 14-15
324.article_body: Several areas in Bengaluru will face power outages on July 14 and 15 to carry out repair and maintenance works in the city, as per Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited's (BESCOM) website. Most of these works will be carried out between 10 am and 6 pm. PB Road and KTJ Nagar are a few areas to face power cuts today.

325.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' return postponed to September: Report
325.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show', which was set to return on-air in August, will reportedly now return in September. "Kapil has...shows till the end of July in the USA...will also perform in Australia on the first weekend of September," a source stated. The source added the channel decided to push the show to September as 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14' will begin.

326.title: Shinde's illegal govt doing no work for floods in Maha: Sanjay Raut
326.article_body: Calling Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's government illegal, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said they are not doing anything for the flood-like situation in the state. "Twelve days have passed and the Maharashtra government is not doing any work...Where is the Governor of Maharashtra for 12 days when the state is suffering from flood-like situations?" Raut said.

327.title: IAF officer stuck with family & dog in SUV amid Pune floods, rescued
327.article_body: An Indian Air Force officer and his family, stuck inside their SUV, which was sinking due to flooding near Pune's Harris Bridge, were rescued along with their pet dog by the fire brigade on Wednesday. The IAF officer's children reportedly climbed atop the vehicle as water levels rose. Fire brigade officials used safety ropes to rescue the family.

328.title: Kevin Spacey pleads not guilty to sex offence charges in UK, to go on trial next year
328.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has pleaded not guilty to four charges of sexually assaulting three men and a fifth charge of causing a person to engage in penetrative sexual activity without consent at London's Old Bailey. Police said the alleged assaults occurred between 2005 and 2013. Spacey will now go on trial in London, beginning on June 6 next year.

329.title: Pictures of Deepika Padukone's lookalike Rijuta Ghosh Deb go viral
329.article_body: Pictures of Rijuta Ghosh Deb have gone viral, with several social media users calling her Deepika Padukone's lookalike. Rijuta describes herself as a digital creator on her Instagram bio. "At first I thought she's Deepika Padukone," a comment on one of her posts read. "Deepika Padukone's doppelganger," an Instagram user wrote while another comment read, "You look like Deepika Padukone."

330.title: 23-yr-old kickboxer Nikhil dies after getting punched during championship in Bengaluru
330.article_body: A 23-year-old kickboxer named Nikhil passed away at a hospital after getting punched during a state-level K1 kickboxing championship in Bengaluru. The Bengaluru police have registered a case of negligence against the organisers of the competition. A video from the event shows Nikhil collapsing in the ring after getting punched in the face by his opponent.

331.title: I switch off the TV after a point: Ravichandran Ashwin on ODI cricket
331.article_body: Talking about the state of ODI cricket, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "Greatest beauty of one-day cricket is...sorry...was...ebbs and flows of the game." He added, "People used to bide their time and take the game deep." Ashwin stated, "Even me...as a cricket badger and a cricket nut...I switch off the TV after a point and that's frankly very scary for the format."

332.title: Thane's Ulhas river water level comes down from danger level
332.article_body: The water level of Ulhas river, which reached 17.70 metres on Wednesday crossing the danger level, came down to 14.90 metres on Thursday morning. The rural areas of Badlapur and Kalyan talukas were alerted after the water level increased. Around 300 riverside residents were shifted to safer places and those having riverside houses were instructed to move to upper floors.

333.title: England gift jersey to 6-yr-old girl who was hit by Rohit's six, pic goes viral
333.article_body: England gifted their jersey to the six-year-old girl who was hit by Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six during the first ODI at The Oval in London. A picture of the girl holding a brand new England jersey has gone viral on social media. "Laudable gesture," a fan commented on the viral picture.

334.title: Trump called witness who is yet to appear before committee investigating Jan 6 riots
334.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called a witness who is yet to appear before a congressional committee investigating the January 6 US Capitol attack. The witness did not pick up Trump's call but did tell their lawyer. "We will take any effort to influence witness testimony very seriously," the committee said.

335.title: Plants bud in newly asphalted road in B'luru; BBMP faces criticism
335.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is facing criticism from the residents after plants sprouted from a newly asphalted road in Varthur. The civic body had spent ₹24 crores on the road, which was laid just 10 days ago. The residents alleged that the soil under it wasn't cleared before asphalting, hence the seeds germinated with plants sprouting from it.

336.title: Priest begins protest outside Hong Kong jail for release of activists
336.article_body: A Catholic priest launched a three-day protest outside a maximum security prison in Hong Kong on Thursday. Franco Mella, a longtime rights activist in the Chinese-ruled city, is demanding the release of activists and democratic politicians held under a national security law. The 74-year-old has pledged not to eat for the entire duration of his protest.

337.title: Water storage in Pune dams rises as rains continue to lash city
337.article_body: The water storage in all four dams upstream of the Mutha river in Pune has increased to 14.11 TMC as heavy rains continue to lash the city. The Panshet area witnessed 128 mm rainfall and Khadakwasla 54 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours. The Khadakwasla dam is filled to capacity and water is being released to Mutha river.

338.title: Russia's economic shock to blame for Sri Lanka crisis: Zelenskyy
338.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed Russia for creating an "economic shock" by blocking food exports amid the Ukraine war, which he said led to crisis in Sri Lanka. "Shocking food and fuel price hikes led to...social explosion [in Sri Lanka]," he added. Zelenskyy also said that disruption in the global supply chain of these products has benefited Russia's agenda.

339.title: #Bazball: Jimmy Neesham reacts to his 91-run knock in county match
339.article_body: Reacting to a video of his shots from his 91-run innings for Northamptonshire, New Zealand all-rounder Jimmy Neesham tweeted, "#Bazball". The term 'Bazball' is being used for England's aggressive approach in Test cricket. Neesham slammed 11 fours and two sixes in his 91-run innings off 101 balls in a recent county match.

340.title: Father, 2 friends get 20-yr jail for gang-rape of minor daughter in Mumbai
340.article_body: A father and his two friends have been convicted to 20 years in jail for gang-rape of his 16-year-old daughter in Mumbai over a period of two months in 2018. The father was earlier in jail in an attempt to murder case. The victim claimed her father had begun sexually assaulting her a few days after his return from jail.

341.title: Bomb squad deployed as suspicious cylinder found in J&K's Akhnoor
341.article_body: A suspicious cylinder was found in the Akhnoor sector of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, the local police said. Bomb squad and police have been deployed at the spot. More details are awaited. This comes after police and security forces defused a gas cylinder fitted with five-kg firecrackers in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Tuesday.

342.title: 3 people injured in leopard attack in Rajasthan's Jaipur
342.article_body: Three villagers were injured after a leopard attacked them in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Thursday. According to police, the leopard had entered the village at around 2:30 am. It later entered a building of the Apex University following which it was tranquillised by a forest department team, police added. One of the victims suffered serious injuries, said SHO Dilip Singh.

343.title: SRK not factor behind quitting 'Dunki', he's too much of a gentleman: DOP
343.article_body: Amit Roy, who recently quit as the Director of Photography of 'Dunki', has said that the film's lead actor Shah Rukh Khan was not the factor behind quitting the film. "It was a thing between a director and DOP. SRK is anyway too gentlemanly to get into that relationship," he added. The film is directed by Rajkumar Hirani.

344.title: Trained extensively for Bihari dialect: Janhvi on her role in Good Luck Jerry
344.article_body: Speaking about her role in 'Good Luck Jerry', actress Janhvi Kapoor said she trained extensively for 'Bihari' accent. "I trained extensively for the Bihari dialect. I was made to do an exercise wherein [my coach] would make me say Bihari abuses as a part of the training," she added. "The whole process was...lot of fun eventually," Janhvi said.

345.title: England shouldn't think of scoring 350 right from start: RP Singh
345.article_body: Ahead of the second ODI between England and India, ex-cricketer RP Singh has said England shouldn't think of scoring 350 right from the start and need to "change their template a bit". He added, "[England] will have to assess the conditions first and then adjust." India dismissed England for 110 runs and won the first ODI by 10 wickets.

346.title: Won't support any law that mandates 2 children: Owaisi
346.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that he will not support any law that mandates two children only policy as it would not benefit the country. "We should not repeat the mistakes of China...India's total fertility rate is declining, by 2030 it will stabilise," he added. Earlier, he criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath over his "population imbalance" remark.

347.title: 4 hospitals ordered to shut permanently after 16-yr-old was forced to sell her eggs in TN
347.article_body: Four hospitals in Tamil Nadu were ordered to shut permanently by the state health department for their alleged involvement in sale of egg cells of a 16-year-old. The girl was forced by her mother to sell her egg cells eight times. "Aadhaar card was forged to show the minor...as...adult. A fictitious husband's consent was obtained," the state Health Minister said.

348.title: Depends on book in Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary: Kharge
348.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are now banned in Parliament, Congress’ Mallikarjun Kharge said it depends on book in the Parliament that decides on words being unparliamentary. "We'll use those words that he (PM Modi) had used in his parliamentary career, we'll tell him what words he used in debates. He himself used these words," Kharge added.

349.title: Patralekhaa putting sindoor on me on our wedding was impulsive: Rajkummar
349.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, opening up about his wife Patralekhaa putting sindoor on him on their wedding day, has said that none of them had planned it. "We both are equal and that's how it should be. So, yeah, it was very impulsive...I am glad it happened and I am hoping that somewhere it [struck] people's hearts," he further added.

350.title: India announce their squad for T20I series against West Indies, Kohli not included
350.article_body: India have announced their squad for the T20I series against West Indies. Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have not been included in the squad, while KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav have been included subject to fitness. The squad also includes Ravichandran Ashwin, Ravi Bishnoi, Harshal Patel, Arshdeep Singh and Avesh Khan.

351.title: Man kidnaps & rapes 13-year-old girl in Gurugram; booked
