351.article_body: Police have booked a man for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl in Gurugram. The accused, who lives in the same neighbourhood, had allegedly been raping her for two months. "She said that he had threatened to kill her family if she revealed it to anyone," her father claimed. He also alleged that the accused had kidnapped her on July 8.

352.title: I sprained my neck a week before the shoot: Dhanush on 'The Gray Man'
352.article_body: Dhanush, who will next be seen in 'The Gray Man', revealed he sprained his neck a week before filming began. "I...was like 'What am I going to do?' The physio had..a week's time to get me ready to match Ana De Armas' speed," he stated. "Somehow, they found a way to make me fit for the stunt sequence," he added.

353.title: India will struggle if they look at Hardik as their 5th bowler: Nehra
353.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said Team India will struggle if they are considering all-rounder Hardik Pandya as their fifth bowler in ODIs. "He can only be your sixth bowler," added Nehra. "Hardik [won't go]...to...West Indies for [the] ODIs which is good," he stated. Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar had earlier said he's worried about the all-rounder bowling 10 overs in ODIs.

354.title: Hyd police arrests 1 person for procuring fake educational certificates
354.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Wednesday said that it has arrested one person for procuring fake educational certificates. Police also seized fake marksheets and certificate of Himalayan University from the accused. According to police, the accused works at an IT company in Hyderabad. He did not complete his graduation and had thus obtained the fake certificates by paying ₹75,000, police added.

355.title: FM has called planets to rescue the economy: P Chidambaram
355.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said, "We're not surprised that Finance Minister tweeted pictures of Jupiter, Pluto and Uranus on the day when inflation printed at 7.01% and unemployment printed at 7.8%," he tweeted. "To begin with, she should appoint new CEA: Chief Economic Astrologer," he added. "The FM has called the planets to...rescue of the economy," he further added.

356.title: Ever tried putting lion on leash, it breaks: Cong's Manish Tewari
356.article_body: Congress leader Manish Tewari on Wednesday tweeted, "Ever tried putting a lion on a leash? Only one thing happens, the leash breaks." Earlier, Tewari refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against the Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, didn't sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme.

357.title: You cannot drop Virat Kohli straightaway: Ashish Nehra
357.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's current form, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "You cannot just drop him straightaway because of his lack of runs." Nehra stated, "He has scored ample runs in international cricket and has done so much for the country." Nehra further stated, "Yes...he hasn’t been consistent and he himself would be knowing...he hasn’t performed up to his calibre."

358.title: Biggest Supermoon of 2022 lights up night skies around the world, pics surface
358.article_body: The biggest Supermoon of 2022 lit up night skies around the world, with the Moon being closest to the Earth at a distance of 3,57,264 km. The July 13 full Moon is also called the Buck Moon because the antlers of bucks or male deer normally grow around this time, as per The Old Farmer's Almanac.

359.title: Next we'll be asked to wear saffron dress: Adhir on 'unparliamentary' words list
359.article_body: Reacting to the new list of unparliamentary words released by Lok Sabha Secretariat, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that Centre is making a "second republic" by bringing such rules. "At present, they (Centre) are saying that certain words can't be used inside Parliament, tomorrow they'll ask to enter premises in a saffron dress," the Congress leader said.

360.title: Petrol price cut by ₹5 per litre, diesel price by ₹3 per litre in Maharashtra
360.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Thursday announced that the price of petrol and diesel in the state will be reduced by ₹5 per litre and ₹3 per litre respectively. This comes days after the Chief Minister said that his government will cut VAT on fuel to provide relief to the people of Maharashtra.

361.title: Curfew imposed in Colombo till Friday morning to prevent further unrest
361.article_body: Sri Lanka's acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe has imposed a curfew in Colombo from 12 pm on July 14 to 5 am on July 15 in a bid to prevent further unrest. Wickremesinghe was appointed as acting President after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country with his wife amid mass protests over the economic crisis. Protesters are also demanding Wickremesinghe's resignation.

362.title: Big-screen offerings remain my main focus: Ranveer on his OTT debut
362.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who recently made his OTT debut with 'Ranveer vs Wild', has said that he is most comfortable playing characters in theatres. "The big-screen offerings remain my main focus," he stated. Ranveer added, "That said, I'm grateful that the OTT platform has offered me the opportunity to endear myself and entertain the audience."

363.title: 10-yr-old rape victim went to neighbouring state to end pregnancy after US abortion ban
363.article_body: Ohio police have confirmed that a 10-year-old rape victim crossed state lines to terminate her pregnancy after the US Supreme Court overturned a federal right to abortion care. A 27-year-old man from Columbus, Ohio was arrested on July 12 and charged with raping the girl. The girl received an abortion in Indianapolis, Indiana on June 30.

364.title: Rohit, Dhawan made it look so easy on a difficult pitch: Darren Gough
364.article_body: Former England cricketer Darren Gough has said Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan made batting look easy on a "difficult pitch" in the first England ODI. Gough added, "I am a massive fan of Shikhar Dhawan. He's got a lot of style. He plays some unbelievable shots through the off side." Dhawan scored 31*(54) while Rohit slammed 76*(58) in the game.

365.title: We should be ranked no. 1: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq
365.article_body: Talking about Pakistan who're currently ranked sixth in Tests, fourth in ODIs and third in T20Is, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Abdul Razzaq said Pakistan should be ranked number one. "The way we are performing in all...three departments: batting, bowling and fielding, we can see a unity in this side," added Razzaq. "I don't think India can compete with Pakistan," he'd stated.

366.title: Masaba Gupta responds to Instagram user who said 'it's an irony you are in fashion'
366.article_body: An Instagram user commented that Masaba Gupta looked bad and it's an irony she's in fashion. She replied, being in any industry involves talent, hard work and discipline, adding, "As for my face, that's just a pretty bonus (as is my mind that is as sharp as a knife and your bulls**t wouldn't get past it even if you tried)."

367.title: Don't wait for any alliance, gear up for BMC polls: Pawar tells party cadre
367.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday asked his party cadre to gear up preparations for elections to the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC). "Don't wait for NCP to stitch up...alliance with any party but start work with an eye on BMC elections," Pawar said. He further asked NCP workers to step up outreach with voters to increase the party's presence.

368.title: Fire breaks out at hotel in Delhi's Paharganj; 10 rescued
368.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in a room on the second floor of Roma Deluxe Hotel in Delhi's Paharganj on early Thursday morning. The fire tenders have rescued 10 people from the second and third floors of the hotel. "Four fire tenders were rushed to the site. No injuries have been reported so far," Delhi Fire Services said.

369.title: Not yet: Manjrekar on whether Bumrah is in same league as Wasim Akram
369.article_body: On being asked whether Jasprit Bumrah is in the same league as Wasim Akram and Malcolm Marshall, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "Not yet." He added, "Akram and Marshall are the guys who've done it over a long period of time and done it in all conditions. These are all-time greats." Manjrekar, however, stated that Bumrah is currently the most feared pacer.

370.title: US carries out two successful hypersonic missile tests
370.article_body: The US has successfully tested two Lockheed Martin Corp hypersonic missiles recently, the Pentagon said on Wednesday. The US Air Force tested its Air-Launched Rapid Response Weapon (ARRW) booster on Tuesday off the California coast. In a separate test, America's Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency successfully performed the first test of its Operational Fires hypersonic weapon in New Mexico.

371.title: Swimming pool, multi-gym inside park against rules: K'taka HC tells BBMP
371.article_body: Karnataka High Court has ordered the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) against constructing a swimming pool or gym inside the Gayathri Devi Park. Such constructions are prohibited in parks, playfields and open spaces in Karnataka, the HC said. Advocate GR Mohan had alleged that BBMP was doing the illegal construction on proposals given by the 'land mafia'.

372.title: Sri Lanka President boards plane that will take him to Singapore and then to Jeddah
372.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has boarded a Saudi Airlines plane from Maldives that will take him to Singapore and then to Jeddah in Saudi Arabia, Associated Press reported citing Maldives government officials. Rajapaksa had agreed to step down on July 13 after fleeing the country. Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker has said he is yet to receive the resignation letter.

373.title: It's simple, Umran Malik needs time, he's not ready for int'l cricket: Aakash
373.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said pacer Umran Malik is not yet ready for international cricket. "Umran has something that others don't have, extreme pace...but he needs time. He hasn't played a lot of cricket and so he is still raw," added Aakash. Umran had conceded 56 runs in his four overs in the third England T20I.

374.title: Bengaluru police bust inter-state drug racket, drugs worth ₹4 cr seized
374.article_body: Bengaluru City Police's Central Crime Branch (CCB) on Wednesday busted an inter-state drug racket and arrested four persons for smuggling hashish oil and ganja. Police also seized drugs worth ₹4 crore from the accused. According to police, the accused had links with the tribals living in the forests of Andhra Pradesh and used to stay with them to grow marijuana.

375.title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, who tested positive for COVID-19, hospitalised
375.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has been admitted to a private hospital in Chennai for investigation and observation for COVID-19-related symptoms. This comes after he said on July 12 that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and isolated himself. Stalin had recently attended a wedding and met a group of people, including the Dravidar Kazhagam leader, K Veeramani.

376.title: 32 killed in K'taka so far amid heavy rains; CM disburses ₹500 cr for restoration work
376.article_body: As many as 32 persons have lost their lives so far in Karnataka due to rain-related incidents. CM Basavaraj Bommai said that ₹500 crore will be disbursed immediately for restoration work of basic infrastructure. CM Bommai added that five people are missing, 34 are injured, more than 300 persons have been evacuated and 14 relief camps have been set up.

377.title: It took me time to get over the Sanjay Dutt hangover: Ranbir on 'Sanju'
377.article_body: Talking about his film 'Sanju' which is a biopic on Sanjay Dutt, Ranbir Kapoor said it took time to get over the "Dutt" hangover. "My eyes became like him, I started smiling...and...walking like him," added Ranbir. Discussing a scene from 'Sanju' where he attends the premiere of 'Rocky', Ranbir had stated, "I was really born as an actor [in it]."

378.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
378.article_body: The IMD has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states over the next few days. Very heavy rainfall is very likely over Karnataka today. It is very likely over Madhya Pradesh on July 17 and 18 and over Chhattisgarh from July 16 to 18. Odisha, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat could also witness heavy rainfall in the next few days.

379.title: He himself knows it hasn't been good, he has got to find his way: Ganguly on Kohli's form
379.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's form, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said, "He himself knows by his own standards it has not been good." "He has got to find his way and become successful, which he has been for the last 12-13 years," Ganguly added. Ganguly further stated that these things happen in sport and have happened to everybody.

380.title: 550 women sue Uber in US, say they were 'raped, harassed' by drivers; firm responds
380.article_body: Uber has been sued in the US by 550 women who claimed they "were kidnapped, sexually assaulted, sexually battered, raped, stalked, harassed, or otherwise attacked by Uber drivers". "Sexual assault is a horrific crime and we take every single report seriously," an Uber spokesperson said. "There is nothing more important than safety," the spokesperson further said.

381.title: If needed, the lion will bite too: Anupam on National Emblem controversy
381.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher has reacted to the controversy over the representation of the National Emblem above the new Parliament building. "If the lion has teeth, it will...show them. This is...the lion of independent India. If needed, the lion will bite too," Anupam tweeted. Several opposition leaders have claimed that the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.

382.title: Indian Railways books cab for student after train gets cancelled; he shares video message
382.article_body: The Indian Railways booked a cab for an Aerospace engineering student from IIT Madras after his train from Ekta Nagar railway station to Vadodara station was cancelled. Satyam Gadhvi said that due to heavy rains, some portions of the railway tracks connecting Ekta Nagar and Vadodara were washed out. The student shared a video message thanking Indian Railways' staff.

383.title: 11 rescued after wall of abandoned building falls on nearby houses in Pune
383.article_body: As many as 11 persons were rescued after a wall of an abandoned building fell on nearby houses in Pune's Kondhwa Budruk. No casualties or injuries were reported in the incident. "The building is very dilapidated...all the residents have moved out owing to its condition. A side wall of this building fell down on three small houses," an official said.

384.title: Rishi ji was upset after Deepika, Sonam's comments on Ranbir at 'Koffee...': Karan
384.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed Rishi Kapoor was upset after actresses Deepika Padukone and Sonam Kapoor's comments on his son Ranbir Kapoor during their appearance on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2010. "I had to step in to make things alright," he added. "Many times, it has happened...I had to step in to douse the fire after rapid-fire," he stated.

385.title: Anything can be said against ex-VP, nothing against Prez candidate: Cong
385.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera said that the situation of the country is such that anything can be said against a Former Vice President but nothing can be said against the political ideologies of a person who is a Presidential candidate. His statement comes a day after BJP accused Hamid Ansari of inviting a Pakistani journalist having links with ISI.

386.title: If Virat Kohli plays in 2nd England ODI, he should replace Shreyas: Jaffer
386.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said if Virat Kohli plays in the second ODI against England, then he should replace Shreyas Iyer in the playing XI. "Suryakumar Yadav batted well in the T20Is. He's in good form, you can't take him out...It's a little unfortunate for Shreyas," added Jaffer. Kohli missed the first ODI due to a groin injury.

387.title: Gupkar alliance, NC greatest hurdle in fight against terrorism: BJP
387.article_body: J&K BJP unit’s spokesperson Girdhari Lal Raina said that the National Conference and Gupkar alliance are the greatest hurdles in the fight against terrorism. "Instead of educating youngsters about the futility of violence and terrorism, these self-centred, power-hungry and pursuers of dynastic politics are instigating people by their inciting statements," Raina added.

388.title: Novak is welcome to Australia: Aus Open director post his deportation
388.article_body: Following Novak Djokovic's deportation from Australia due to being unvaccinated against COVID-19, having arrived for featuring in the Australian Open 2022, the tournament's director Craig Tiley said Djokovic is "always welcome" to Australia. "Djokovic is practically invincible at...Central Stadium," added Tiley. "I was disappointed, I was sad about the way it...played out," Djokovic had said.

389.title: Congress to hold nationwide protest against ED summons to Sonia Gandhi
389.article_body: Congress has announced that it will hold nationwide protest on July 21 when Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. "[Sonia Gandhi] isn't afraid...she will go to...ED office and face this government," said Mallikarjun Kharge. Notably, former Congress President Rahul Gandhi was questioned by ED last month.

390.title: UP woman pours hot oil on 6-yr-old adopted daughter's private parts
390.article_body: A 35-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow was arrested for allegedly causing burn injuries to her six-year-old adopted daughter by pouring hot oil on her private parts. The woman's husband had adopted the girl six months ago as the couple didn't have any children. The woman was, however, unhappy with it and would often misbehave with her, police said.

391.title: Bolein toh bolein kya?: Opposition on list of words banned in Parliament
391.article_body: Reacting to a list of words that are banned in the Parliament, Shiv Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted, "Reminded of this meme. Agar karein toh karein kya, bolein toh bolein kya?" TMC's Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Is 'Truth' unparliamentary?" Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "All words used by the Opposition to describe the reality of Modi Sarkar now to be considered 'unparliamentary'."

392.title: Ronaldo incredibly frustrated with Man Utd, will leave: Piers Morgan
392.article_body: British broadcaster Piers Morgan said Cristiano Ronaldo is incredibly frustrated by the lack of dedication, desire to win, hunger of the players at Manchester United. "Ronaldo will leave...He is tired," added Morgan. "United are in a pretty bad place...You can't blame Ronaldo for wanting to leave, why would he want to stay?...His frustration has been boiling...throughout the year," he'd stated.

393.title: HC allows impleadment of politicians for Delhi 2020 riots hate speech cases
393.article_body: Delhi High Court allowed the applications impleading several political leaders in connection with alleged hate speeches made during the 2020 Delhi riots. An impleadment plea sought the prosecution of BJP leaders Kapil Mishra, Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Verma and Abhay Verma. Another plea sought for impleadment of leaders including Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Manish Sisodia and others.

394.title: India's sugar, onion exports affected due to Sri Lankan crisis: Report
394.article_body: The ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka has affected the Indian exports of sugar and onion, said a report. Of the 40,000-50,000 tonnes of sugar which Sri Lanka consumes every month, 90% is sourced from India, the report stated. The Indian exporters have stopped sending onions there and the exporters who had traded are yet to receive payments, it said.

395.title: List of words banned in Parliament released
395.article_body: Lok Sabha Secretariat has released a list of words that will be considered unparliamentary, which included 'corrupt', 'lie', 'jumlajeevi', 'nikamma', 'hypocrisy' and 'incompetent'. Words like 'anarchist' and 'dictatorial' will also be expunged if used during debates. The list, however, said that some of the words may not appear unparliamentary unless read in conjunction with other expressions.

396.title: Tourist falls into volcano crater while trying to recover his fallen cellphone in Italy
396.article_body: An American tourist was rescued on Mount Vesuvius near Naples after he slipped into the Italian volcano's crater while trying to recover his fallen cellphone. Reports said that the tourist went off the authorised path to get closer to the crater. The tourist suffered abrasions on his legs, arm and back.

397.title: Ram should be the lead in international films: 'The Witcher...' writer
397.article_body: Screenwriter Aaron Stewart-Ahn, known for writing 'The Witcher: Blood Origin', tweeted that Ram Charan who starred in 'RRR' should be the lead in international films if he features in them. "Hollywood usually doesn't get that...Would love to write a movie for a...star like Ram...just to work with such a great actor and cinematic presence," he added in his tweet.

398.title: What BJP did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy isn’t secret: Ajoy Kumar
398.article_body: Congress’ Ajoy Kumar said BJP is now thinking about Adivasis but what it did to tribal rights activist Father Stan Swamy is not a secret. "The whole country knows BJP's Dalit and anti-tribal policies," he tweeted. Earlier, Kumar said NDA’s Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu represents a "very evil philosophy of India" and should not be made a "symbol of Adivasi".

399.title: Sri Lankan Army refuses to follow instructions of acting President Wickremesinghe
399.article_body: The Sri Lankan Army has refused to follow instructions of acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe to use force against the protestors. Wickremesinghe was appointed as acting President after Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled to the Maldives with his wife. Rajapaksa is heading to Singapore from Maldives, according to reports.

400.title: Actresses are replaced easily, makers wait for yrs for male actors: Taapsee
400.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, speaking about battling sexism in the film industry, has said that the root cause of all the problems that a female actor faces is because they are "easily replaceable". "The ease with which a female actor is replaced is...different from how directors and producers wait for years for a male actor, or write scripts for them," she added.

401.title: I'm confident that Asia Cup will take place in Sri Lanka: Jayasuriya
401.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya said he's confident that Asia Cup, scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka next month, will take place despite the country's ongoing political and financial crisis. "There's no threat to the tournament. In Sri Lanka, everyone loves cricket," he stated. Meanwhile, the Asian Cricket Council has reportedly kept Bangladesh on standby to host the tournament.
